title: Nexus install fails as `az cli` needs access to `login.microsoftonline.com`
body: When deploy nexus the bootstrap fails as access to `login.microsoftonline.com` is required as `part of /etc/cron.daily/configure_nexus_ssl.sh`.

title: AML workspace service fails to install and puts firewall into failed state
body:
**Describe the bug**
When deploy the AML workspace service it fails to install as `aml_fqdn` is missing as an output and the firewall pipeline has a blank value.

```
Error message: expected "application_rule_collection.3.rule.0.destination_fqdns.1" to not be an empty string, 
```

title: TRE Cli missing dependencies
body:
**Describe the bug**
TRE Cli missing dependencies for azure identity

title: Deployment repo fails on installing the new release
body:
**Describe the bug**

The installation of azure-cli-core in tre-cli fails due to mismatching versions of msal library.

title: The Canonical URL for all Docs Pages is Wrong
body:
Home page (and all pages) use the wrong domain in canonical URL.

This is the markup from homepage `https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/v0.9.0/`:

```
<link rel="canonical" href="https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/v0.9.0/">
```

Notice that the domain and path are wrong.

This results in broken (404) links if you share the URL using any "Share" panels (rather than direct copy/paste from address bar). Also, I imagine SEO is broken by this.

title: Cannot Update Workspace when Workspace Service is deployed
body:
When a workspace (base) contains a workspace service (guacamole), you get the following error when attempting to update it:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35696285/228859381-fefd9d43-bb8e-4808-884e-09d09d8e6cef.png)

To Reproduce:
- Create a new Workspace, using the base template
- Update the workspace - change the description - works as expected.
- Inside the workspace, deploy a new Workspace Service: Guacamole
- Now update the workspace -> Failure message seen above.

Haven't looked but early guess that it might be related to the cascade disable/delete, as it only happens when the workspace has a service in it.

title: Deployment custom user resource bundle failed in Github Actions
body:
As a TREAdmin I want to deploy custom GPU virtual machine, it fails during GitHub actions deployment with the following error:


`    Usage: /home/vscode/AzureTRE//devops/scripts/register_bundle_with_api.sh [-c --current] [-i --insecure]

    Options:
        -r, --acr-name                Azure Container Registry Name
        -t, --bundle-type             Bundle type: workspace, workspace_service, user_resource or shared_service
        -w, --workspace-service-name  The template name of the user resource (if registering a user_resource)
        -c, --current                 Make this the currently deployed version of this template
        -v, --verify                  Verify registration with the API
        --dry-run                     Don't submit the template to the API, just output the payload`

However, it works on a local machine, when running on Docker from Visual Studio Code with a custom make command: **user_resource_bundle_custom**


**Steps to reproduce**

1. Copy **guacamole-azure-windowsvm** folder into our repository
3. Rename it to **guacamole-azure-windowsvm- gpu** 
4. Modify template_schema.json to include new os_image:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/228774821-90f540f0-0bb1-4e2e-b964-b1a21c2b9ba0.png)
5. Modify porter.yaml to include new option.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/228775119-ffdf7e89-7655-4369-b477-1fdfbf8c7f84.png)

6. Insert extra bundles into **deploy_tre_reusable.yml** file:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/228775936-c08747da-f8fa-4baf-85d0-e6e328d9537e.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/228775697-728bb737-5481-4fd1-83ea-a88818509b32.png)

7. Modify **Makefile**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/228776679-bef9a4fd-74f6-4962-b8e4-6260d9d27006.png)

title: Use the new repo for the environment configuration module
body:
**Describe the bug**
Change to the new https://github.com/microsoft/terraform-azurerm-environment-configuration when importing the  terraform_azurerm_environment_configuration module

title: Deployment custom Windows Virtual Machine workspace service failed.
body:
As an AzureTRE admin I want to deploy a customized windows virtual machine from an image stored in Azure Compute Gallery.
When deployed in AzureTRE  workspace service UI we got the following error:
` Error message: Unable to find image 'arctremric01.azurecr.io/tre-service-guacamole-windowsvm-custom@sha256:fe806a279359d88aabb18960b579d827d6ad3c817d5618325f29c290ae8a6ca7' locally [31m╷[0m[0m [31m│[0m [0m[1m[31mError: [0m[0m[1mwaiting for creation of Windows Virtual Machine: (Name "windowsvmf713" / Resource Group "rg-tremric01-ws-d6da"): Code="OSProvisioningClientError" Message="OS Provisioning for VM 'windowsvmf713' did not finish in the allotted time. However, the VM guest agent was detected running. This suggests the guest OS has not been properly prepared to be used as a VM image (with CreateOption=FromImage). To resolve this issue, either use the VHD as is with CreateOption=Attach or prepare it properly for use as an image:\r\n * Instructions for Windows: https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-windows-upload-image/ \r\n * Instructions for Linux: https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-linux-capture-image/`

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Create a VM:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225304308-c35b13c3-ac2a-4d0e-abde-3bdf8f157195.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225304332-8c6523fd-bf86-4840-9c52-dd4c7fea5ad5.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225304377-9d7a0be5-fd19-4fe1-86b9-f005508e20a3.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225304431-a2cda2e5-87d0-4967-842f-e8fca88a5e5e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225304450-fcdfbb14-7209-483d-aaa3-3ce352a302bf.png)

2. Capture the VM:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225304767-b5f896fa-6e02-4c07-9aba-bfbb38729aa2.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225304806-75583755-1e34-47b3-bd27-464bce1593a2.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225304825-7ea28c76-cefa-403d-bde3-ca6015e05b09.png)

3. Visual Studio Code setup:

- copied the whole guacamole-azure-windows folder from AzureTRE into our repo:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225306430-cb99e14c-c23d-4109-9138-476693a74dd3.png)

- modified template_schema.json to include new os_image:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225307759-3cc2d8fa-c4ab-4a6e-8c62-b33952edc4ed.png)

- modified porter.yaml file to include new image option:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225307854-445d0557-0a19-48d0-846c-9bf395f7d7f6.png)

- added default image_id in porter.yaml file

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225307971-7daebd5c-3e3b-4bd5-8dba-1180085a2889.png)

 - Modified makefile for command

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107872721/225308489-7681fb94-bb0c-4e07-b77c-fe67b86b0526.png)


- Run command

make user_resource_bundle_custom WORKSPACE_SERVICE=guacamole BUNDLE=guacamole-azure-windowsvm-custom

title: Multiple RP_BUNDLE_ values causes RP initialisation failure
body:
When specifying more than one value in `RP_BUNDLE_VALUES`, the terraform splits the key/value pairs out but when injecting them in to the yaml file each value after the first does not contain the correct spacing to be valid yaml - such:

```
stuff:
   rp_bundle_val1: value_1
rp_bundle_val2: value_2 <-- missing spacing to bring into correct block.
rp_bundle_val3: value_3
```

The terraform needs updating to include the space.

title: Power Shell command not executed during workspace services - user resources deployment.
body: As an Azure TRE developer, I would like to execute a command during user resource deployment, to have extra features available for a Workspace Researcher. For the purpose of this exercise I tried to install `seaborn` Python library. After deploying the resource using Visual Studio Code, `seaborn` is still not available. **Steps to reproduce** 1. Modify **vm_config.ps1** (under AzureTRE/templates/workspace_services/guacamole/user_resources/guacamole-azure-windowsvm /terraform) - insert `conda install -c anaconda seaborn` into line 34 2. Modify **porter.yaml** (under AzureTRE/templates/workspace_services/guacamole/user_resources/guacamole-azure-windowsvm /terraform) - update version: - line 4 3. Run command in a VS terminal: `make user_resource_bundle WORKSPACE_SERVICE=guacamole BUNDLE=guacamole-azure-windowsvm` 4. Create new Windows VM in Azure Workspace UI (os image **Server 2019 Data Science VM**) 5. Open Virtual Desktop. 6. Run command `conda list i`n a Power Shell. If this is a wrong approach, please advise us what is the best way to get custom packages/software installed during a resource deployment.

As a result, we have to query the cosmos database manually, filtering by workspace ID which is also time consuming.

title: Overlapping address space on workspace creation
body:
Based on this error message when creating a couple of TRE workspaces based on a template. When you don't specify a custom address space, TRE will create the address based on the size you have specified. Unfortunately, it has not been checked if the address space was already set for another workspace:

Hence this:

```
Message="Cannot create or update peering /subscriptions/*******/resourceGroups/rg-****tredev2-ws-071f/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/vnet-****tredev2-ws-071f/virtualNetworkPeerings/ws-core-peer-****tredev2-ws-071f.

Virtual networks /subscriptions/*******/resourceGroups/rg-****tredev2-ws-071f/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/vnet-****tredev2-ws-071f and /subscriptions/*******/resourceGroups/rg-****tredev2/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/vnet-****tredev2 
cannot be peered because address space of the first virtual network overlaps with address space of virtual network 
/subscriptions/*******/resourceGroups/rg-****tredev2-ws-e2f1/providers/Microsoft.Network/virtualNetworks/vnet-****tredev2-ws-e2f1 already peered with the second virtual network. Overlapping address prefixes: 10.1.7.0/24.
```

There should be a checking mechanism for this in the workspace upon creation

Maybe this is related: https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/2986 but in our case we perform this sequentially, whereas the ticket mentioned performs workspace creation in parallel

title: Failure to create storage account using --auth-mode login
body:
When executing the ‘make all’ command we encounter an issue related to the authentication mode when trying to create a storage account (codesnippet: AzureTRE > devops > terraform > bootstrap.sh > ln16 - ln25 ).
By default, the ‘--auth-mode’ is set to ‘login’—when executing this we see the below error related to network rules.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107870922/220132082-a2e45095-0764-4925-a1fa-e828c9f79f35.png)
The error message indicates the use of ‘networkRuleSet’ to enable permissions. However, this also does not resolve the issue.
Only approach that allowed us to create the storage account was to change the authentication mode from --auth-mode login to --account-key.

title: Destination for Azure Blob Storage has specific URL requirements that are not obvious
body:
**Describe the bug**
Upon attempting to download from blob storage following an approved AirLock process, an `Azure CLI` command is generated with the SAS token - all that is required is to change the destination folder path. However, the destination path must not be within quotation marks

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Upload to an airlock using the usual method
2. A URL will be generated which looks like: `az storage blob download-batch --destination <~/destination/path/for/file> --source SOURCE-HASH --account-name ACCOUNT-BAME --sas-token "REALLY-LONG-SAS-TOKEN"
3. Notice the `<~/destination/path/for/file>`; this should be a fully formed path and not in quotation marks (e.g. it cannot be "~/". Otherwise, an error stating that "incorrect usage: destination must be an existing directory"

Would be good to specify that in the documentation or ensure that the error is appropriate for the error.

title: Terraform keeps detecting changes in log_analytics_destination_type
body:
**Describe the bug**

Looks like a recent azurerm provider change makes it detect changes and make updates for azurerm_monitor_diagnostic_setting due to log_analytics_destination_type.

title: Running a pipeline for two different resources of the same type fails
body:
Since the stepId in the pipeline is hardcoded, if we have two resources that need to run the same pipeline (but on a different parent resource) it will fail since the step id is not unique enough
 note- today it will only happen for two guacamole ws service in the same ws which is unlikely, but the only reason we haven't encountered it yet is since the user resources do not have pipelines (yet)

title: Registering a template with duplicated stepId value succeed
body:
**Describe the bug**
As for today, the stepId for a step in a pipeline that is described in the template json schema has an hardcoded stepId value. If giving the same stepId to more than one step (which will cause malfunction in the operation logic) it manages to register the template without any errors.

Need to allow Registering only if all stepIds are unique.

title: Certs E2E fails due to letsencrypt limits per week
body:
**Describe the bug**

The E2E that includes the Certs shared service will fail twice a week due to throttling letsencrypt does.

> An unexpected error occurred: Error creating new order :: too many certificates (5) already issued for this exact set of domains in the last 168 hours

title: E2E Fixtures cause 401 errors
body:
**Describe the bug**

The E2E fixtures return the auth token to be used by future requests to the API. The reality is that the fixtures might live for long time including the token they create which is eventually expired but the tests continue to use it.

IMO:
1. We need to refactor how we use the token in the tests and hopefully generate the token just before we use it.
2. Check why the API returns a wrong error in this case: 
```
AssertionError:` The resource couldn't be sent. Expected: [202]. Actual: 401. Response text: Unable to decode or validate token
```

**Steps to reproduce**

A number of E2E tests fail due to this error.
https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/actions/runs/4099484774/jobs/7069628121#step:3:998

title: Align the permissions of Airlock GET container URL
body:
## Description

As a workspace owner, the API will let you create an airlock request but will not let you get the container URL. 
We need to make sure that every role that is able to create an airlock request is able to upload files to it.

## Acceptance criteria
- [x] Every role that is able to create an airlock request, should also be able to get the container URL
- [x] Unit tests that verifies the previous requirement for all roles

title: bundle-build might fail on params and/or literal errors
body:
**Describe the bug**

`make bundle-build` might fail on weird literal errors and/or the entire parameters set missing.

This is related to porter's 'autobuild' procedure which has an [open issue](https://github.com/getporter/porter/issues/2531). 
For now, there're temporary fixes in place which will need to be reverted once we have a more permanent solution from porter.

title: Provide ability to copy URL to access an internally accessible resource.
body:
As a researcher I can click on a connect button to access a TRE resource. If a resource is only available internally I cannot click connect. I do however need to be able to copy the URI. I cannot do this at present. The AML service shows a button that doesn't work, others there is no button.

Reproduce:
- Workspace with VMs and AML with no public access
- Login as Workspace Researcher (not owner)
- Access AML

Notes:
At present we have `connection_uri` and `internal_connection_uri`. We also have `is_exposed_externally`. Using a combination of these fields the appropriate behaviour should occur. If accessible, a button to click, if not a button to copy URI to the clipboard.

title: make db-migrate is not working
body:
**Describe the bug**
We upgraded TRE CORE to v0.7.0 and in the release notes we saw this:

[0.7.0](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/releases/tag/v0.7.0)
BREAKING CHANGES & MIGRATIONS:

The airlock request object has changed. Make sure you have ran the db migration step after deploying the new API image and UI (which runs automatically in make all/make tre-deploy but can be manually invoked with **make db-migrate**) so that existing requests in your DB are migrated to the new model.

We executed **make db-migrate** command and we got this output:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104429461/214551277-5e6673b3-f477-4d62-bb6e-6c34cb7dcea3.png)

But, still we have an issue when we want to review Airlock requests:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104429461/214551517-0d7aff4f-e3c3-4c64-bb33-36a2d6fffb51.png)

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Run **make db-migrate** on TEST environment
2. Log in to swagger for workspace and run GET /api/workspaces/{workspace_id}/requests from the airlock section

title: tre cli doesn't refresh old environment token and api uri when creating a new environment
body:
**Describe the bug**
tre cli doesn't refresh old environment token and api uri when creating a new environment

**Steps to reproduce**

1. deploy a TRE environment.
1. change tre id in config.yml and deploy a new environment.
1. deployment will fail on registering the FW because the tre uri and token still points to the old environment (see error below).

**Workaround until fixed:**
change the condition `if [[ $got_token_from_cli == "0" ]]; then` to `if [[ $got_token_from_cli == "1" ]]; then` in file `ensure_cli_signed_in.sh` line number 10 to force tre cli to login to the new environment.



![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179107/213425421-08e5fc28-1bb2-4dc6-8c5a-88c54ca12def.png)

title: Upgrade of unrestricted workspace template fails as missing address_spaces in bundle params
body:
There is a issue in the upgrade stage of the unrestricted workspace template.

It shows:

`address_spaces: ${ bundle.parameters.address_spaces }`

but the input parameters only include `address_space`.

The template should be updated to use the latest base template version and use `address_spaces` throughout.

title: Deploying AML workspace service get stuck and eventually fail when deployed in multi tenant environment.
body:
**Describe the bug**
Deploying AML workspace service get stuck and eventually fail when deployed in multi tenant environment.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Deploy TRE in a subscription which is linked to a different AAD tenant than the users are managed on
1. Deploy AML workspace service and watch resource processor stuck on creating aml data scientist users:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3179107/211864855-16528a08-ed36-4000-8805-0c5230ad1444.png)
1. Eventually it will fail with an error like this:

```
│ Error: authorization.RoleAssignmentsClient#Create: Failure responding to request: StatusCode=400 -- Original Error: autorest/azure: Service returned an error. Status=400 Code="PrincipalNotFound" Message="Principal 643e0d2b1dac4472b01fd816fe693c65 
does not exist in the directory *******. Check that you have the correct principal ID. If you are creating this principal and then immediately assigning a role, this error might be related to a replication delay. In this case, set the role assignment principalType property to a value, such as ServicePrincipal, User, or Group.  See [https://aka.ms/docs-principaltype"](https://aka.ms/docs-principaltype%22)
│ │   with azurerm_role_assignment.app_role_members_aml_data_scientist["643e0d2b-1dac-4472-b01f-d816fe693c65"],│   on roles.tf line 22, in resource "azurerm_role_assignment" "app_role_members_aml_data_scientist":│   22: resource "azurerm_role_assignment" "app_role_members_aml_data_scientist" {

```

Consider adding a note which says this will only work if using the same tenant or fix the bash script to filter the principals by the correct tenant.

title: Errors in DeploymentStatus messages should redirect to dead letter queue
body:
**Describe the bug**
When the API fails to parse the DeploymentStatus message, it logs an error but marks as complete. The result is that the message is tried once and then lost but it should arrive in the dead letter queue for someone to look on. 

The relevant code is here: https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/api_app/service_bus/deployment_status_updater.py#L84

**Steps to reproduce**

1. place a json message in the deployment status queue that doesn't confirm to the model expected

title: Unable to build CNAB invocation image: requires BuildKit
body:
In our DevOps CICD pipeline a new error has occurred for `make bundle-build bundle-publish` of certain bundles. The ones that did not fail are: Guacamole, AzureML, Gitea, MLflow, AdminVM, Firewall, Shared Gitea.

All others failed with the same error:
```
[2022-12-13T11:39:20.118Z]  ---> Using cache
 ---> 4feb4e9fcfba
Step 13/22 : RUN --mount=type=cache,target=/var/cache/apt --mount=type=cache,target=/var/lib/apt 	apt-get update && apt-get install -y apt-transport-https lsb-release gnupg curl

[2022-12-13T11:39:20.144Z] Error: unable to build CNAB invocation image: failed to stream docker build output: the --mount option requires BuildKit. Refer to https://docs.docker.com/go/buildkit/ to learn how to build images with BuildKit enabled

[2022-12-13T11:39:20.144Z] make: *** [/home/vscode/AzureTRE/Makefile:179: bundle-build] Error 1

[2022-12-13T11:39:50.147Z] Failed!
```
For the full output see this file: [buildkiterror.txt](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/files/10218149/buildkit.txt)


**Describe the bug**
This error occurs when merging a PR to main. The PR was for a small typo in VM sizes so would have no effect.


**Steps to reproduce**
1. Create a PR to make a small change. This pipeline is successful.
2. Complete the PR to merge to main, this error occurs for certain bundles.
3. Choosing `Run new` to rerun the pipeline causes the same bundles to have the error.

title: Environment cleanup in CI fails to remove certain resources
body:
Remember to label the issue with the appropriate area, and also assign it to yourself if you plan to work on the issue in the near future.

**Describe the bug**
Running `devops/scripts/destroy_env_no_terraform.sh` in Github Actions uses Azure CLI 2.42.0 while our devcontainer used 2.37.0. In one of the version between those there's a change in how the output of `az monitor diagnostic-settings list` is returned and now it's a plain array in the root of the object, no `value` property is present.
Hence, this line will not do anything which is causing duplicate resources errors when we try to recreate a CI environment:
`az monitor diagnostic-settings list --resource "$1" --query "value[].name" -o tsv 2> /dev/null |`

title: All API routes should log errors with stack trace
body:
Many routes log errors with just the exception message which makes it hard to understand some errors and where they come from.
This is especially true in situations where the route returns an HTTP exception to the client.

As example from the log:
```
Failed to create workspace model instance: Only decimal digits permitted in "{'address_space': '10" in "{'address_space': '10.1.177.0"
```
Custom dimension data will show:
```json
{"process":"MainProcess","module":"workspaces","fileName":"/api/./api/routes/workspaces.py","lineNumber":"100","level":"ERROR"}
```
But that doesn't help too much since workspace.py:100 is the line where the log was generated in the route

# if it's a shared service, should be a singleton across the TRE, get it by template name

body:
Guacamole Workspace Service Deployment

"stepTitle": "Add Guacamole URI as AAD redirect URI"

AzureTRE/devops/scripts/aad/create_workspace_application.sh --name "TRE_DEV - workmiguel1" --admin-consent --ux-clientid "xxx" --automation-clientid "xxx" --application-admin-clientid "xxx"

title: TRE Services - Upgrade and Documentation
body:
The TRE resources all need to be upgraded as new versions are released. When deploying services via the deployment pipeline or via manual steps the same result can be seen and the services are not updated.

`Resource upgrade isn't currently implemented. See https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/141`

There are conversations currently about upgrading resources and how this should be approached (#1744) but, at the moment there is nothing in the documentation on the best approach when upgrading/ re-deploying an existing service.

For example, our Firewall is on version 0.4.0 and re-deployment causes the above error. 

     Is the best approach to deploy a second firewall and then delete the existing to ensure there is no downtime 
     for this shared service?

**Describe the bug**
Upgrading TRE services fails, mainly an issue with shared services that do not want to be deleted each time there is a new version.

The main cause of concern is lack of documentation on the topic. Best practices for re-deployment, particularly for a firewall, is required.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Have a pre-existing TRE with shared services deployed.
2. Upgrade the porter version of one of these shared services, such as nexus.
3. run `make deploy-shared-service DIR=./AzureTRE/templates/shared_services/sonatype-nexus-vm/ BUNDLE_TYPE=shared_service PROPS="--ssl_cert_name nexus-ssl"`
4. See the above error of `Resource upgrade isn't currently implemented.`

title: TRE Cost API doesn't handle 429 TooManyRequests and 503 ServiceUnavailable which might return from Azure Cost Management
body:
**Describe the bug**
Azure cost management API might return ```429 TooManyRequests``` which means that the request is throttled, and ```503 ServiceUnavailable``` which means that the  service is temporarily unavailable.

Cost Reporting API doesn't handle those errors and simply returns 500.

Consider propagate that status to UI for retry, or retry in API and if fails hide in UI and cache the result to reduce api cost management calls:

-  429 TooManyRequests - Request is throttled. Retry after waiting for the time specified in the "x-ms-ratelimit-microsoft.consumption-retry-after" header.

- 503 ServiceUnavailable - Service is temporarily unavailable. Retry after waiting for the time specified in the "Retry-After" header.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Deploy Azure TRE in ARIS subscription type
1. Browse main page in UI and refresh quickly several times

example for returned relevant HTTP headers for 200 OK:

x-ms-ratelimit-remaining-microsoft.costmanagement-entity-requests: DefaultQuota:7
x-ms-ratelimit-remaining-microsoft.costmanagement-tenant-requests: DefaultQuota:49
x-ms-ratelimit-microsoft.costmanagement-qpu-consumed: 2
x-ms-ratelimit-microsoft.costmanagement-qpu-remaining: QueriesPerHour:597,QueriesPerMin:57,QueriesPer10Sec:9

example for returned relevant HTTP headers for 429 TooManyRequests:

x-ms-ratelimit-remaining-subscription-resource-requests: 98
x-ms-ratelimit-microsoft.costmanagement-entity-retry-after: 23
x-ms-ratelimit-remaining-microsoft.costmanagement-entity-requests: DefaultQuota:0

title: Quickstart docs missing `make bundle-build` step in workspace services
body:
The docs at https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/tre-admins/setup-instructions/ui-install-ws-and-ur/ are missing the critical bundle-build step for building the bundles before publishing and registering. Instead of just fixing this, it should be amended to use the new single command for each bundle type:

```bash
make workspace_bundle BUNDLE=base
make workspace_service_bundle BUNDLE=guacamole
make shared_service_bundle BUNDLE=sonatype_nexus_vm
make user_resource_bundle WORKSPACE_SERVICE=guacamole BUNDLE=tre-service-guacamole-windowsvm
```

Also `nexus_version` needs to be removed from the user resource step as this is no longer in the schema

title: Gitea Workspace Service documentation
body: **Describe the bug** The documentation for setting up Gitea as a Workspace Service is not very detailed and is out of date. I am trying to set up Gitea but there are steps within the docs that no longer apply. Such as: "The Gitea workspace service container image needs building and pushing: `make build-gitea-workspace-service-image push-gitea-workspace-service-image`" There is also not enough information or it is incorrect as following the steps gives a 403 error when trying to connect to the service. **Steps to reproduce** 1. Run `make bundle-build bundle-publish DIR=templates/workspace_services/gitea` 1. Run `make bundle-register DIR=templates/workspace_services/gitea/ BUNDLE_TYPE=workspace_service` 1. Go to the TRE UI and Deploy Gitea 2. When Deploying fill in the required information: 2.1 Enter the OpenID Client ID is the Workspace App registration Application (client) ID. _This can be found in the KeyVault for the Workspace and on the Overview page of the App registration_ 2.2 Enter the OpenID Client Secret. _This can only be found in the KeyVault for the Workspace._ 2.3 Enter the OpenID Authority: https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant_id}/v2.0 3. Within the App registration, go to the Authentication tab in the blade on the left-hand side and add the Gitea redirect URI. In the form `https:///user/oauth2/oidc/callback` (gitea_url can be found by clicking on the details tab of the deployed service) 4. Deploy the Workspace Service **This is where it fails** 5. Press Connect on the Workspace Service. 6. I see a 403 error In the documentation it says `Navigate to the Gitea workspace service and from the menu click the Sign in button.` Does this mean press Connect and it should ask you to sign in?

title: Makefile rule "deploy-shared-service" fails during firewall deployment
body:
I've been working lately days on deploying shared services, and couldn't sort a problem regarding the tre-shared-service-firewall.

**Describe the bug**
The Makefile on the root of the repo has the following rule:

```
deploy-shared-service:
	@# NOTE: ACR_NAME below comes from the env files, so needs the double '$$'. Others are set on command execution and don't
	$(call target_title, "Deploying ${DIR} shared service") \
	&& . ${MAKEFILE_DIR}/devops/scripts/check_dependencies.sh porter,env,auth \
	&& . ${MAKEFILE_DIR}/devops/scripts/get_access_token.sh \
	&& cd ${DIR} \
	&& ${MAKEFILE_DIR}/devops/scripts/deploy_shared_service.sh --insecure --tre_url "$${TRE_URL:-https://$${TRE_ID}.$${LOCATION}.cloudapp.azure.com}" $${PROPS}
```

Everything goes fine until the script deploy_shared_service.sh is called. It means, for instance, that the access token is correctly retrieved. Please observe that the firewall version is 0.4.4. It means that I made a change in the file porter.yaml, in order to increase this version number. The original one was 0.4.3, and even tough the deployment failed.

This message was really cryptic: `unable to resolve credential azure.azure_tenant_id from env ARM_TENANT_ID: could not connect to the secrets.azure.keyvault plugin: Incompatible API version with plugin. Plugin version: 2, Client versions: [1]:`

Which API is this one?

What I have tried so far:

1. Provide hardcoded values for the variables ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID, ARM_CLIENT_SECRET, ARM_CLIENT_ID and ARM_TENANT_ID. Actually, the set-up process includes setting ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID variable in the file devops/.env.
2. Use Swagger UI for launching the deployment. It means, instead of using make command.

Thank you very much!

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Set-up TRE as explained in the official site
1. Launch VS Code and use a devcontainer
1. Run make all

title: Cannot create private AML compute
body:
**Describe the bug**
When trying to create AML compute with no public IP fails with

```
Provisioning error
The subnet has a network security group (/subscriptions/xxx/resourceGroups/rg-xxx-ws-
98b8/providers/Microsoft.Network/networkSecurityGroups/nsg-ws) that is
missing the following rules below. Please add those rules or increase the
priority to allow traffic if the rules already exist. For network security group
requirements, please refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/machine-
learning/how-to-secure-training-vnet?tabs=azure-studio#azure-machine.
learning-compute-clusterinstance-1.
f
"name": "Outbound Storage 445"
"properties": {
"protocol": "TCP",
"sourcePortRange": "*"
"destinationPortRange": "445"
"sourceAddressPrefix": "VirtualNetwork"
"destinationAddressPrefix": "Storage OR Internet OR Storage.uksouth",
"priority": "Higher than 4096",
"direction": "Outbound"
```

Looks like the compute is trying to access public storage(?), which is disabled https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/ae3efacebc864ae310aa7eb753d7d002be5aff49/templates/workspace_services/azureml/terraform/network.tf#L110 

because the service isn't exposed externally. I've had a look at https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-secure-workspace-vnet?tabs=pe%2Ccli#azure-storage-account and there is some storage inside the ws vnet that has a private endpoint, so I'm not really any the wiser. 

Any help would be much appreciated! 

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Deploy TRE v0.6.0
2. Create workspace with AML (not exposed publicly) and VMs (exposed publicly)
3. Log into VM
4. Go to the AML URL
5. Try to create some compute, ticking the "No public IP (preview)" checkbox

title: Resource Processor Not OK
body:
**Describe the bug**

We have seen errors in the `make db-migrate` deployment step with the output from the API healthcheck showing the Resource Processor being unhealthy:

```json
{"services":[{"service":"Cosmos DB","status":"OK","message":""},{"service":"Service Bus","status":"OK","message":""},{"service":"Resource Processor","status":"Not OK","message":"Unspecified error"}]}
```

There is no additional information in the App Insights logs to help diagnose.

**Steps to reproduce**

This issue has surfaced in environments where we are making performing a high number of builds/deployments.
Running `curl <API>/api/health` in a bash loop will trigger the issue, and then it will be observed in a deployment to that environment

title: Uninstalling guacamole ws service doesn't remove fw rules
body:
**Describe the bug**

Uninstalling a Guacamole workspace service for VMs does not remove the firewall rules. Just seems to be missing from the template:

https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/18d53d5cb4b2cc384eeaa6a72f31177b8a945606/templates/workspace_services/guacamole/template_schema.json#L121


Please  do close this if this is the intended behaviour, but I couldn't see why it should be!

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Create Guacamole workspace service in a TRE (with UI)
1. Delete service
1. Find that the fw rules for the deleted object are still there

title: AML deployment fails due to incorrect variable name in NSG script
body:
```
NSG_RULE_MAX_PRIORITY=$(az network nsg rule list -g "${resource_group_name?}" --nsg-name  "${resource_group_name?}" --query "not_null(max_by([?direction=='${direction?}' && access=='Allow'],&priority).priority) || '100'" -o json)
```

`--nsg-name  "${resource_group_name?}"` should be `nsg_name`

title: Airlock UI - clicking between quick filters doesn't clear previous filters
body: When clicking between quick filters (i.e. my requests and awaiting my review), previous filters are not unset meaning that the status=in_review filter selected by "Awaiting my review" will remain when clicking My Requests, even though it should show requests of all states

title: Airlock incorrectly assigns latest update user to initiator of request
body:
When an airlock request is updated, the creator_user_id field is overwritten with the user that's just updated the request. This field should be untouched by subsequent updates after creation.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Create an airlock request in draft
1. Sign in as a different user with appropriate permissions and submit the draft request
1. It will change the initiator to the latter user

title: New Porter Plugin/Mixin versions break the system
body:
**Describe the bug**

The Porter Azure plugin has recently been updated with a breaking change - they removed support in Azure Tables for state storage.
This breaks the Resource Processor if its image is being rebuilt from scratch.

title: Upgrading TRE version docs should be more clear
body:
**Describe the bug**

We should update the docs regarding upgrading the Azure TRE version in the deployment repo. It's not as simple as:

> To upgrade AzureTRE version go to [devcontainer.json](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE-Deployment/blob/main/.devcontainer/devcontainer.json) and update the OSS_VERSION param to the desired version.

1. In https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE-Deployment#upgrading-azuretre-version headings are a bit confusing, the "Configuration Setup" looks like a subheading of Upgrading.

2. Add steps about updating the workflows and dev container.

Use:
git remote add upstream https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE-Deployment
git pull upstream azuretre-v0.5.1 --allow-unrelated-histories

Then going through the merge bit by bit.

title: Deployment failure due to db-migrate
body:
**Describe the bug**

We've updated to v0.5.1 and are having trouble deploying the TRE. The deployment fails with

```
make: *** [/home/vscode/AzureTRE/Makefile:344: db-migrate] Error 1
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
Date: Tue, 18 Oct 2022 16:52:04 GMT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 23
Connection: keep-alive
Server: uvicorn

list index out of range
Error while migrating state store
Error: Process completed with exit code 2.
```

I've dug into this a little more and the 400 occurs at https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/316b9d168a05c880f4f4ae168eb2fb3e699e3085/devops/scripts/migrate_state_store.sh#L81

I'm pretty certain the secrets are right, but could be proved otherwise!

cc: @marrobi

title: Documentation: Shared service docs don't include makefile deployment step
body:
**Describe the bug**
Currently the docs at https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/docs/tre-admins/setup-instructions/configuring-shared-services.md mention configuring shared services and how to deploy using Swagger, but they don't include instructions using the make command, `make deploy-shared-service` (which was removed from the `make all` path). This has led a few people now to miss this step when configuring CICD scenarios and wonder why things aren't set up for Guacamole and other things that depend on one of the shared services.

We should include the deployment steps as part of the set up guide for each shared service and change the title from configuring shared services to deploying them. We should also consider highlighting the dependencies on Nexus for the Guacamole Workspace Service to ensure there is not confusion during set up.

That can introduce bugs as build time should match runtime version.

title: JSON Payload is not generated
body:
The command sequence (as described in Section 7 of Quick Start):
```shell
make bundle-publish DIR=./templates/workspace_services/guacamole BUNDLE_TYPE=workspace_service
make bundle-register DIR=./templates/workspace_services/guacamole BUNDLE_TYPE=workspace_service
```
does not generate any JSON Payload.

Can you please provide a JSON template for the `workspace-service-templates` (POST) route? Or a manual on how to get this JSON Payload.

Also, the sequence of commands in the manual is incorrect; you need to build that image first (by running `make bundle-build DIR=./templates/workspace_services/guacamole`).

Thank you.

title: AML Public IP Compute Deployment fails due to required routes
body:
When using publicly exposed compute instance with Azure Machine learning the following route table entries are required:
```
az network route-table route create -g MyResourceGroup --route-table-name MyRouteTable -n AzureMLRoute --address-prefix AzureMachineLearning --next-hop-type Internet
az network route-table route create -g MyResourceGroup --route-table-name MyRouteTable -n BatchRoute --address-prefix BatchNodeManagement.westus2 --next-hop-type Internet
```

Without these deployment of the compute fails

title: Missing Start and Stop commands from User Roles document
body:
Remember to label the issue with the appropriate area, and also assign it to yourself if you plan to work on the issue in the near future.

Reference: https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/azure-tre-overview/user-roles/

Please add the commands for starting and stopping the TRE environment and what the impacts are ie:
- does removing the FW rules put data at risk
- how much $$ is saved by shutting down the TRE
- what items are stopped / deallocated and / or removed
- what is the impact of stopping the TRE environment, ie impacts to IP's and networking when the TRE is restarted

**Describe the bug**
The issues are 
- users are not aware of these commands (unless they read the makefile) which results un-necessary costs while users are not using the TRE environment 

TRE Start and Stop commands from the Makefile are not described in the documentation 

**Steps to reproduce**

1. go to this page... https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/azure-tre-overview/user-roles/

title: Azure ML workspace service fails if no Workspace Researchers
body:
The AML workspace service adds any users with the `Workspace Researcher` role to Azure ML Data Scientist Role.

If the Workspace Service is deployed prior to any users being granted the `Workspace Researcher` role then deployment will fail.

The addition of users to the role needs to be conditional on there being users to add ( https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/7ece0dc63b61a100041b469955f6e7d0f708a3c7/templates/workspace_services/azureml/terraform/roles.tf#L22 )

Workaround is to add users (or have group auto create configured) to the `Workspace Researcher` role prior to deploying the AML workspace service.

title: With auto_create no interactive user is the owner of the Workspace Enterprise App

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
When creating a workspace with `auto_create` the workspace owner is set to the `Application Admin` account. This means that to add any users to the App Roles the interactive user must have privileges to access all Enterprise Apps in Azure AD, or ask their AD Admin to grant them access.

I suggest the creator of the workspace is also made an owner of the Workspace Enterprise application. This will mean they can also view sign in logs.

The user needs adding here: https://github.com/marrobi/AzureTRE/blob/caf6a9c2e68f7e74684249d112e2b083f77ac3a9/templates/workspaces/base/terraform/aad/aad.tf#L97

title: Researchers unable to update / see custom actions on User Resources
body: Researchers using the UI should be able to see the `...` menu on a resource, and use that to switch the VM on and off / update the details etc, whereas they currently don't see those options.

title: Permissions for workspaces are not consistent when not a TRE Admin
body:
Currently, a workspace owner can create and modify resources within their workspace, but cannot modify / perform custom actions on the workspace itself. This doesn't feel like it would meet customer expectations, as the 'owner' of an item is usually expected to be able to update that item. One common thing the workspace owner might want to do is update the Overview (markdown) field in their workspace to populate project details. In future, actions such as 'Archive' might be available within custom actions, which the Owner would also want to access. 

PROPOSAL:
- Update the permissions on the `PATCH /workspace/<id>` and the `POST /workspaces/<id>/invoke-action` endpoints to allow workspace owner to execute them
- Update the permissions on the `GET /workspace-templates` endpoint to allow `TRE Users` to view the workspace templates. We need this as we need to get the template before performing the `PATCH` above.
- Show appropriate buttons in the UI when a user is a Workspace Owner and not a TRE Admin.

RISKS / CONSIDERATIONS:
- All users of the TRE would be able to query the workspace templates. All users are currently able to query workspace service templates so I don't think we're adding risk - but a customer would need to ensure they didn't have a workspace template named in a way that could leak sensitive information to other TRE users (such as "Partner X Workspace Template").
- The workspace owner could disable (or in future, archive) their workspace. This is a feature and a consideration.

title: Skip sending step result events for Airlock updates that do not include a status change
body:
# Resolves #2540, #2534

## What is being addressed

As part of #2504, Airlock requests might be updated without updating their status (for instance, enumerating the request files adds the files to the request without changing its status), however the method that updates the requests is also responsible for sending `status changed` events, so when there is an update to an Airlock request, a status changed event is triggered, in cases where it was not necessary, such as in file enumeration this resulted in duplicated step results.

## How is this addressed

-  If there is no status change in `update_and_publish_event_airlock_request`, we skip the send of status changed event
- Added unit tests to enforce the previous bullet
- Changed the E2E test to stop polling the request status if the current status is final and will not change.

title: Resource processor run "porter show" when it shouldn't
body:
**Describe the bug**

At the end of an action, the resource processor runs `porter show` but doesn't use the output. It will also run the same command again when it needs to fetch outputs.
Normally that might be ok, but for shared services like the firewall which has many executions that takes 4-5 minutes. Plus, it keeps getting longer as more executions are added.

title: Airlock request fails in E2E
body:
**Describe the bug**

There's a situation where an airlock request goes into a failed state.
1. We should investigate why - there're errors in the API as well.
2. The E2E shouldn't poll on failed state as that is a terminal one.

https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/runs/8143618838?check_suite_focus=true
https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/runs/8174278643?check_suite_focus=true

title: Resource history blows up document size
body:
**Describe the bug**

Resource history is saved indefinitely along side the current resource version. This causes the document to get larger and larger overtime but CosmosDB is limited to 2MB per item.

This is happening in our CICD environment when many runs change the firewall share service until it gets too large and the API starts to output errors (from cosmos) about the document size. As a temp measure I deleted some items from the history object.

Probably best to think of a way to address this internally (either save last X versions, archive older history items elsewhere, etc.).

There was an agreement about going on and crearing a new container for archiveing older history items.
The tasks that are planned are:

- [x] Create a new container for history
- [x] Create history item in a new container
- [x] Change history item schema to include also parent id 
- [x] Change the query (but still return it as part of the resource as a list) 
- [x] Create an API to return only history for UI usage and undo the list in the resource schema 
- [x] Fix unit tests 
- [x] Write migration script

title: MS Graph queries don't follow pages

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
MS graph implement paging but our queries don't iterate over them. If an identity has many permissions (above ~50) we don't fetch all of them which can cause false 403/permission denied errors. 

This has recently started to happen in the E2E tests, specifically in the AAD enabled ones. The non-AAD ones work correctly because of how the permission results are ordered.

title: E2E Tests failing on main
Resources with Array types have regressed to strings

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
Related to #2473 .

A property such as `address_prefixes` should save in Cosmos as a native array type. Instead it's being saved as a string, which is then causing issues in substitutions in pipelines.

title: Failure to substitute data in a pipeline step not reflected in operation

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
If a pipeline step fails due to bad data / a schema invalidation, the pipeline effectively 'hangs' and the step doesn't get reported as failed. 

If the data is invalid, we need to catch that and report it back to the step so we can show a failure.

title: Deleting a workspace that has a user service is stuck on loading

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
When trying to delete a workspace that has a workspace service, the UI will show loading dialog that will load forever...
If we inspect the network using Chrome dev tools (ctrl+shift+i on Windows), we can see that the backend returns an HTTP 400 error, that says we cannot delete a workspace before deleting its workspace services.
We also cannot delete a workspace service before deleting its user services.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. create a workspace
2. create a workspace service inside that workspace
3. Optional: create a user service inside that workspace service
4. try to delete the workspace (open chrome's network tab before doing so)

title: Unable to download Github CLI to Docker Container via script (gh.sh)
body:
Remember to label the issue with the appropriate area, and also assign it to yourself if you plan to work on the issue in the near future.

**Describe the bug**
While doing the installation of Dynamic pickup of latest github version does not work. I had to hardcode GitHub version (as shown below) in gh.sh so the curl command can download and install.


**Original** : 
curl -sSL "https://github.com/cli/cli/releases/download/v${VERSION}/gh_${VERSION}_linux_amd64.tar.gz" -o /tmp/gh.tar.gz
tar -zxvf /tmp/gh.tar.gz --strip-components 2 -C "$INSTALL_DIR" "gh_${VERSION}_linux_amd64/bin/gh" > /dev/null


**Hardcoded**:
curl -sSL "https://github.com/cli/cli/releases/download/v2.14.3/gh_2.14.3_linux_amd64.tar.gz" -o /tmp/gh.tar.gz
tar -zxvf /tmp/gh.tar.gz --strip-components 2 -C "$INSTALL_DIR" "gh_2.14.3_linux_amd64/bin/gh" > /dev/null


**Steps to reproduce**

1. Install via VSCode  and Docker Desktop on Windows.
2. follow getting started
3. open code in Remote container extension(VSCode) as it tries to load the docker container and downloads required CLI. It failed at the Github CLI download step.

title: Nexus versions mismatch in E2Es, Bundles, CI

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**

1. We have 2 versions of Nexus:
    * V1 in template: tre-shared-service-nexus in path: templates/shared_services/sonatype-nexus
    * V2 in template: tre-shared-service-sonatype-nexus in path: templates/shared_services/sonatype-nexus-vm
2. VM Bundles have a default to V2
3. E2E is deploying tre-shared-service-nexus = V1
4. CI is publishing templates/shared_services/sonatype-nexus = V1

It means we never actually test the thing we deploy in bundles

milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
Currently we can upload more than 1 file to the Airlock request container, however, if we submit a request that contains more than 1 file, it will get stuck on "submitted" status.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. create an Airlock request 
2. upload 2 files
3. submit the request - the request status will be stuck on "submitted"

title: Missing 'delete' permission for Airlock draft requests

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
When a user creates an Airlock (draft) request, they can receive a SAS token for the created container using this endpoint:
`/workspaces/{workspace_id}/requests/{airlock_request_id}/link`.
The returned SAS token does not have permission to delete files from the container, so if a user uploads a file, they cannot undo it.

This is especially  problematic for the UI as users might have to change the files in their request for multiple reasons, such as uploading more than 1 file or exceeding a defined size limit.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. create an airlock request
2. call the `/workspaces/{workspace_id}/requests/{airlock_request_id}/link` endpoint
3. connect to the container using the SAS token
4. upload a file
5. try to delete the file

title: AnotherOperationInProgress in Airlock Terraform

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
On a new build, I sometimes get the following error in the Terraform - Maybe we need to have a depends_on to force the order.

│Error: updating Network Security Group Association for Subnet: (Name "AirlockStorageSubnet" / Virtual Network Name "vnet-***" / Resource Group "rg-***"): network.SubnetsClient#CreateOrUpdate: Failure sending request: StatusCode=0 -- Original Error: autorest/azure: Service returned an error. Status=<nil> Code="AnotherOperationInProgress" Message="Another operation on this or dependent resource is in progress. To retrieve status of the operation use uri: https://***.network.azure.com/subscriptions/***/providers/Microsoft.Network/locations/***/operations/bff21638-d20c-4c6c-8c08-5d39310b71d3?api-version=2021-03-01." Details=[]

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Run a new PR build.

title: Update tags fails when running from a parent repo
body:
**Describe the bug**

PR #2182 introduced resource tags whose values come from git command outputs. That is failing in situations where we deploy from a non-git repo or when the directory context of the update script isn't a git repo.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Have git installed
2. Download the solution as a zip file
3. Run the deployment and get a failure right after the current tags are printed

milestone.title: Backlog

I wanted to deploy two Guacamole services in the same workspace, this is unusual, but used to work. I now get:

title: Clicking Go to resource after creating doesn't always go to correct resource

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release

body:
**Describe the bug**
When creating a VM (or other resources), in parallel to another resource either being deployed or updated (i.e. performing an action on another VM and waiting for completion), after submitting the new VM to deploy and clicking the 'Go to resource' button, if the other resource action completes or updates at the same time or just after submitting the new Vm for deployment, clicking the button will take you to that resource instead of the one you've just created.

title: When a custom action fails, delete connect and action buttons get disabled

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release

body:
**Describe the bug**

As stated in the title when you have a custom action that fails, certain context menu buttons get disabled as the resource thinks its in a failed state - but this shouldn't be the case for individual custom actions that aren't install/update/uninstall. I.e. if Stop Vm fails for any reason, you should still have the button to Connect to it or invoke other actions

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25235950/177371429-4ae0b751-8d4a-4b38-8e92-908810a7ad03.png)

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Push a user resource bundle with a custom action that will fail
1. Deploy that bundle
1. Invoke the action
1. After failure the context buttons will be disabled

The connectivity to package repos may be a transient failure (however it has happened over two successive days) however as part of steps to address this we should
- decrease the timeout of the deploy shared services step
- report RP health back to the calling script as part of the polling and retrying logic to detect failures quicker. The RP was reporting an unhealthy state so this could have been picked up straight away
- Could we check for RP health following its deployment in the pipeline? Then we can fail straight away before proceeding with deployments

title: Airlock processor doesn't need access to cosmos
body:
**Describe the bug**
Currently the Airlock Processor's Id is given a contribution permission over Cosmos which is not needed.

title: Can't connect to Guacamole VM when using an auto-created app-reg
body:
**Describe the bug**
When using the option to auto-create a workspace application registration, we won't be able to connect to a Guacamole VM.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26870601/177045987-dc2f8cfb-e020-46b0-9b1b-2878e7fbf9b5.png)

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Create a workspace with client_id=auto_create parameter
1. Add a Guacamole workspace service, in _workspace_identifier_uri_ param use the workspace property value under _scope_id_ (should start with api://)
1. Add a VM
2. Connect to the VM and see the error above

This doesn't happen with a manually created workspace app-reg

title: make auth fails first time
body:
From a first run/initial set up, `make auth` will return this error:

/workspaces/AzureTRE//devops/scripts/create_aad_assets.sh: line 21: AUTO_WORKSPACE_APP_REGISTRATION: unbound variable
make: *** [Makefile:432: auth] Error 1

This is because `AUTO_WORKSPACE_APP_REGISTRATION` is referenced in the env.sample, but it is commented out.

It needs to be uncommented, OR the code should assume `false` if not set.

title: Fix Cost API Bugs
body:
# Fixes #2144 Fixes #2143

## How is this addressed

- if both ```from_date``` and ```to_date``` query params are ```None``` then query cost management API by ```MonthToDate```
- throw ```WorkspaceDoesNotExist``` exception if workspace is not found and handle in workspace costs API

Workspace Id type should also be checked (guid)

title: Cost and Workspace Cost APIs uses default value for from_date and to_date separately causing unexpected behaviour

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
Cost and Workspace Cost APIs uses default value for from_date and to_date separately causing unexpected behavior.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Query GET /api/costs?from_date=2022-06-01T00%3A00%3A00&granularity=None
1. Should return valid costs data for current month but empty result set is returned.

**Expected result**
Should use current month for report if both from_date and to_date are empty
Should return 400 Bad Request if from_date is bigger than to_date
to_date should default to tomorrows date if not set
from_date should default to today's date if not set

title: Airlock - approve reject - fix input string

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**

As we introduced new statuses such as ApprovalInProgress and RejectionInProgress.
The string we pass to the create review endpoint is 'approved' / 'rejected' which is not the correct stage.

since we dont want the user to pass 'approval_in_progress' / 'rejection_in...' we will replace this with 
approved: true/false

and in the api code, map it to the correct underlying status (which is then free to change when needed / if needed)

title: When registering bundles using make bundle-register, get a 500 error

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
When using `make register-bundle` I get a 500 error. Looking at the logs this is:

```
2022-06-24T15:56:29.453684692Z raise InvalidAudienceError("Invalid audience")
2022-06-24T15:56:29.453689492Z jwt.exceptions.InvalidAudienceError: Invalid audience
```

I ran `make auth` earlier today and copied the variables into my `.env` files.

The audience in my access token is equal to my `API_CLIENT_ID`:   `"aud": "7f0e99c9-5c24-4699-9e2b-90eccc0e25ac",` This matches what is in KeyVault. 

In addition the API should return an authentication error, rather than generic 500 error.

title: UI: App + notifications poller fails when clientId = `auto_create`

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release

body:
When the user sets the AAD client Id to `auto_create` when creating a workspace, the UI is trying to authenticate against it to check workspace services, and is failing.

## What it should do
- [x] Notifications poller: Check the clientId property of the workspace object, and if `auto_create`, do not attempt to drill into it
- [ ] ~~Workspace provider: If page loads on a workspace and the client id is `auto_create`, show an info message to the user and do not render the rest of the page~~ -> Covered by the "better error messages" 
- [x] Workspace card list: Disable card if `auto_create` to prevent user drilling into workspace.
- [x] All: switch from using scope_id to client_id to authenticate against

https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/runs/6923235417?check_suite_focus=true#step:4:691

title: Users resources should be registered after their parent workspace service

Sometimes we see 404 errors when the CI is trying to register user resources. That's is because the parent service hasn't been registered yet and the API rejects the request.

**Steps to reproduce**

https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/runs/6919307061?check_suite_focus=true#step:3:332

title: [flaky api] Disable components check in the API health check
body:

We suspect that some of the api health check logic is causing timeouts. To test this, we would like to disable the logic testing the different services that will immediately return 200 OK without actually testing anything.

To be better able to diagnose the api timeout issues, we want to have it alone in the plan without any other application

title: AAD Authentication is blocked
body: **Describe the bug** Accessing an endpoint implementing AAD authentication is not possible from within the TRE as *.msftauth.net is not allowed in the firewall **Steps to reproduce** 1. Open a browser from within a workspace VM and try to access a URL implementing AAD authN. Note that the target URL should be allowed from within the TRE (workspace firewall rules) 1. title: Copy blobs without sas tokens

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
Today, in the Airlock processor, we use the SAS token for the source blob in order to copy the blob.
There might be an option to copy the containers without issuing a sas token. This issue is to see if possible and fix if it is.

title: Block outbound connectivity

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
Private endpoint traffic does not obey the inbound nsg rules.
As a result traffic is allowed, for example, from the TRE API over private endpoint to a ws storage account.

To mitigate this, we need to BLOCK OUTBOUND connectivity using nsg from all subnets except the RP subnet into the ws vnet
outbound traffic over private endpoints does obey the outbound nsg rules



**Steps to reproduce**

1. deploy tre
1. deploy a base ws
1. update the tre api app to create a storage container in any storage in the ws storages (which has private endpoint)
1. it will work (where it should have failed)

title: Firewall shared service doesn't use stateful_resources_locked env var
body:
**Describe the bug**
When deploying the TRE from a dev machine we usually set stateful_resources_locked=false to make things easier for us. But the bundle doesn't respect.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Set stateful_resources_locked=false in core/.env
2. Deploy an environment 
3. See that a lock has been created on the firewall resource

title: Next available IP range calculator only considers active workspaces
body:
The line:

 `networks = [x.properties["address_space"] for x in self.get_active_workspaces()]`

only considers active workspaces. If a workspace is disabled and later reactivated the ip address range will clash.

title: If create a resource but deployment fails prior to Porter state being created it cannot be deleted

labels.name: story
labels.description: Stories are the smallest unit of work to be done for a project.

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
When create a resource, but do not include required parameters in the API request hence the Porter deployment does not happen the resource cannot be deleted.

See #1825 for more details of an occurrence.

To resolve this I suggest we add a `force` flag, or maybe `skip_uninstall` flag to the delete request that deletes the resource from the DB but does not put a uninstall message on the service bus.

title: Inconsistent state after failed operation: deploy "tre-service-guacamole" without "openid_client_id"
body:
After trying to deploy template "tre-service-guacamole" without supplying the "openid_client_id" parameter, the operation failed, but it created an entry in the workspace services. It now seems impossible to remove this service using the API because the resources were never created succesfully.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. setup base workspace
1. add workspace service using the API for the "tre-service-guacamole" template, omitting the "openid_client_id" parameter. 
Json: 
`{
  "templateName":"tre-service-guacamole",
  "properties": {
    "display_name":"Virtual Desktop",
    "description":"Create virtual desktops for running research workloads",
    "is_exposed_externally":true,
    "guac_disable_copy":true,
    "guac_disable_paste":true
  }
}`
1. wait until operation fails
1. request all workspace services in the API. A new entry is returned for the failed "tre-service-guacamole" service
1. try to remove / updating the service using the API. This results in an error. (string ID replaced with `__ID__` below)
`__ID__: Error context message = Error: 1 error occurred: \t* could not load installation __ID__: Installation does not exist
`

How can I remove this service and obtain a consistent state?

title: .gitignore is ignoring all index.html files
body:
We have an entry in `.gitignore` that currently ignores *all* instances of `index.html`.

Unfortunately, this means that subfolders, such as the `ui` project, can't have instances of `index.html`
The fix is to ignore it in the root only (which is where we generate temp `index.html` files for letsencrypt) and if we need to add additional locations, add them explicitly.

title: Guacamole and Gitea fail because Cannot access AAD_TENANT_ID variable
body:
AAD_TENANT_ID is no longer an app setting in the api webapp, but rather a secret in KeyVault. The api app setting now reads from keyvault `@Microsoft.KeyVault(SecretUri=https://<tre_id>.vault.azure.net/secrets/auth-tenant-id/secretno)`. 

However, when guacamole and gitea are created in Terraform, they referenced this core app setting value as a data element; but it's no longer the value. This resulted in an incorrect value in the guac app setting.

It would be better if we added the AAD_TENANT_ID to the workspace keyvault when we created the workspace and then guacamole and gitea workspace services could reference it, rather than reference core settings.

title: Extended tests take too long to run
body:
The extended tests all run in sequence, and take > 50m, which means the task gets cancelled.

We should try to parallelize these tests.

title: Failed deployment of resources isn't reflected in API / Cosmos

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**

When a resource deployment fails, the status in Cosmos still shows isActive = true, and the resource appears in a list of resources in the API. 

**Steps to reproduce**

I tried this on gitea workspace service and on shared services, but I think it would work on any resource 

1. Trivially break gitea workspace service, e.g. use a non-existing variable in Terraform
2. Build and publish gitea workspace service bundle
3. Run E2E tests and make sure they fail
4. ~The resource object in Cosmos will still have isActive set to true~ The object that has failed to be deployed is still available in the API.  In case of shared services, this prevents a re-deployment of a shared service

title: make all/tre-deploy fails due to db-migrate
body:
**Describe the bug**
Running make `all` (or `tre-deploy` for that matter) fails because it runs `db-migrate` that needs direct access to cosmos.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Make sure you don't have `ENABLE_LOCAL_DEBUGGING=true` in your .env files
2. Deploy a new environment by running `make all` or `make tre-deploy`

title: Service Bus Sessions never terminate
body:
After a processor receives a message on a session, it hangs onto that session indefinitely, blocking the thread and meaning other messages cannot be processed. 

We need to terminate the session after each message has been processed / errored out.

title: azureml service wrong Keyvault Configuration
body:
With the default AML workspace is not able to access keyvault which will result in a "forbidden" error while trying to list datastore or create new ones.

To fix this : 
Key vault is missing the "Allow trusted Microsoft services to bypass this firewall" in the network blade of the Keyvault.

in Terraform it translates by adding a bypass property with a value of "AzureServices" on the network_acls block
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/hashicorp/azurerm/latest/docs/resources/key_vault

title: Health check endpoint should log all the service status as it queries
body:
Currently the `/health` endpoint queries Cosmos / Service Bus / the RP - and returns the statuses. If any are not ok, the response is a 503.

There is currently no way to query that endpoint when the gateway has blocked access - so we at least need it to log the results so we can track back and see what service was down, when.

title: make register-bundle fails if not providing workspace_service_name
body:
register_bundle_with_api.sh now has a check that `if [ ${BUNDLE_TYPE} == "user_resource" ] && [ -z ${workspace_service_name:-} ];` line 105 which is only needed if you are using the automation account to register with the API automatically.  

If you want the payload to be returned to console and don't supply `workspace_service_name` the script fails before the payload is output to the console.

I suggest this if statement be moved down to line ~152 to allow the json to be output to the console if no access token is acquired which is still before `workspace_service_name` is used.

title: Deployment fails on retry: Gitea secrets

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
When running the same query to list KeyVaults via “az rest” from 2 different locations (my local PC and cloud shell) I see different responses. The only difference I can see in the responses is the “x-ms-routing-request-id” . Responses that contain the expected data have this value set to WESTEUROPE, and empty responses show UKSOUTH. We have also seen a similar difference between US east and US west regions, but I was unable to capture those. 

It's been suggested that this relates to the ARM API cache across regions, where the KV being created in a region is immediately added to that cache, whereas there may be a lag for other regions. It's possible it's a temporary, Azure-only issue, but this issue tracks it.

title: Cannot enable Debug logs for terraform build

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
When trying to track down an issue in the build, it's useful to have TF_LOG=DEBUG set. However, we can't do that in the standard way because it will potentially leak secrets into the build logs. 

We need:
- Option to set TF_LOG=DEBUG
- If set, suppress the output from the console and upload the file to az storage to be securely viewed

title: Guacamole E2E tests fail periodically
body:
**Describe the bug**
Sometimes the Guacamole E2E tests will fail with a status 503 return from the ping check.
An example: https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/runs/5402733528?check_suite_focus=true

This is probably due to checking it too soon after the deployment has completed. 
It's sporadic since the deployment time isn't fix and there's a 30 sec delay between checks of the deployment status. Meaning that sometimes it will try to ping some time after the deployment, while in others it will try to ping immediately after.

title: Anaconda Repo Nexus Proxy
body:
DSVMs within Guacamole are currently deployed with anaconda although have no access to the anaconda repo for package management,

Currently `conda install` commands fail as they are trying to get the packages via https://repo.anaconda.com/ rather than a configured proxy.

To amend this:
- [x]  Nexus needs configuring to proxy https://repo.anaconda.com/
- [x] Guacamole user resources need to configure the proxy on initial boot.

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**
On Windows, when you run make all, At one point you have the following error : 

The command failed with an unexpected error. Here is the traceback:
[Errno 1] Operation not permitted: '/home/vscode/.azure/config'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/knack/cli.py", line 231, in invoke
    cmd_result = self.invocation.execute(args)
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/azure/cli/core/commands/__init__.py", line 658, in execute
    raise ex
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/azure/cli/core/commands/__init__.py", line 721, in _run_jobs_serially
    results.append(self._run_job(expanded_arg, cmd_copy))
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/azure/cli/core/commands/__init__.py", line 692, in _run_job
    result = cmd_copy(params)
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/azure/cli/core/commands/__init__.py", line 328, in __call__
    return self.handler(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/azure/cli/core/commands/command_operation.py", line 121, in handler
    return op(**command_args)
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/azure/cli/command_modules/config/custom.py", line 41, in config_set
    cmd.cli_ctx.config.set_value(section, name, _normalize_config_value(value))
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/knack/config.py", line 161, in set_value
    self._config_file_chain[-1].set_value(section, option, value)
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/knack/config.py", line 240, in set_value
    self.set(config)
  File "/opt/az/lib/python3.6/site-packages/knack/config.py", line 229, in set
    os.chmod(self.config_path, stat.S_IRUSR | stat.S_IWUSR)
PermissionError: [Errno 1] Operation not permitted: '/home/vscode/.azure/config'

**Steps to reproduce**

(issue occured on 2 unrelated env)

1. On Windows with WSL, follow tutorial steps
1. At "Make All" you have the issue above. 

**Analysis**

This is related to :
az config set extension.use_dynamic_install=yes_without_prompt 
in devops/scripts/control_tre.sh

Workaround was to : 
 1. run "sudo rm ~/.azure/commandIndex.json"  
 2. in control_tre.sh, replace the line with : **sudo** az config set extension.use_dynamic_install=yes_without_prompt
 3. run make all again

title: letsencrypt.sh fails when running from AzDO in same region as the deployment
body:
When `letsencrypt.sh` is run is attempts to write a file into the App Gateway storage account (the static web app) to create an `index.html`. In order to do this it needs to...

1. add the *public* IP address of the machine running the script into the Allow list
2. write the file
3. remove the *public* IP address of the machine

This works fine *apart from* a situation where the machine running the script has access to internal networking routes to the storage account. So, in a situation where...

- An Azure Host Build Agent runs this script from (for example) the `UK South` region
- The deployment, and hence storage account, is in that same region

... then an internal route is taken and public IP is never used.

I've tried the following...

1. Tried to add the private/internal IP to the allow-list (won't work: you can only add public IPs)
2. Tried turning on routing preferences (no difference...still fails)
3. Tried using internetrouted endpoints (no difference...still fails)

Using logging on the storage account, in all cases I see a 10.*.*.* address being used to access the storage account, and consequently rejected due to firewall rules.

Work arounds:

1. Turn the fire wall rules off during this step
2. Ensure that your build agent is in a different data centre
3. Use a custom build agent with NAT and public IP.

title: Scripts Should Error With Non-Zero Exit Codes
body:
There are a number of bash scripts that use `exit` rather than `exit 1` when terminating the script in error situations. 

For example:

https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/devops/scripts/check_dependencies.sh#L38

These should exit with a non-zero exit code to allow CI/CD to terminate in these situations.

title: Core images will not be used unless the version is updated
body:
