If one makes a change to a core image (like the API) but without updating the version file, then the image won't be used by a preexisting TRE environment.
This is especially problematic while developing and running CICD as it can cause failures in the environment representing the main branch (which is preexisting).

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Deploy a new TRE environment `make all`
1. Make a change in the API that will be visible to you without changing _version.py file.
1. Update the TRE environment by running `make all` again
1. Notice that the API hasn't changed

title: Resource Processor: No space left on device
body:
Error:
`failed to register layer: ApplyLayer exit status 1 stdout:  stderr: write /cnab/app/terraform/.terraform/providers/registry.terraform.io/hashicorp/random/3.1.0/linux_amd64/terraform-provider-random_v3.1.0_x5: no space left on device `

As part of developing and testing new user resource templates, multiple variations of the created images are stored on disk in the resource processor (vmss-rp-porter-<tre_id>).  Eventually, the disk will reach its maximum capacity and this will prevent new user resources from being deployed.

Although this could immediately affect dev work it could eventually affect mature/long running TREs.

A clean up operation could be created to clean up older, redundant images stored on the resource processor.

As a short term solution, connection to the vmss-rp-porter scale set instance and manually removing redundant images frees up the disk space needed to continue creating new user resources.

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Register and deploy multiple different versions of user resources
2. Eventually an error will be returned stating `No space left on device`.
NOTE:  I had a total of 63 images on the resource processor when the issue arose.

title: Linux VM scale set password requirements incorrect

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
**Describe the bug**
`make all` may fail due to the Linux VM Scale Set password not meeting the requirements

```
Error: creating Linux Virtual Machine Scale Set "vmss-rp-porter-vmtre1" (Resource Group "rg-vmtre1"): 
compute.VirtualMachineScaleSetsClient#CreateOrUpdate: Failure sending request: StatusCode=400 -- Original Error: 
Code="InvalidParameter" Message="The supplied password must be between 6-72 characters long and must satisfy at least 3 of 
password complexity requirements from the following:\r\n1) Contains an uppercase character\r\n2) Contains a lowercase 
character\r\n3) Contains a numeric digit\r\n4) Contains a special character\r\n5) Control characters are not allowed" 
Target="adminPassword"

with module.resource_processor_vmss_porter[0].azurerm_linux_virtual_machine_scale_set.vm_linux,
on resource_processor/vmss_porter/main.tf line 53, in resource "azurerm_linux_virtual_machine_scale_set" "vm_linux":
53: resource "azurerm_linux_virtual_machine_scale_set" "vm_linux" {
```

**Steps to reproduce**

1. run `make all`

**Fix**
Add additional properties to random_password in /templates/core/terraform/resource_processor/vmss_porter/main.tf

replace
```
resource "random_password" "password" {
  length           = 16
  special          = true
  override_special = "_%@"
}
```

with
```
resource "random_password" "password" {
  length           = 16
  lower            = true
  min_lower        = 1
  upper            = true
  min_upper        = 1
  number           = true
  min_numeric      = 1
  special          = true
  min_special      = 1
  override_special = "_%@"
}
```

title: Buildkit setting doesn't get into the devcontainer in CI
body:
**Describe the bug**
When running github actions using the devcontainer, the value of docker buildkit isn't passed to the docker run command. This prevents optimizations when building images (like cache)

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Look into the custom action file: .github/actions/devcontainer_run_command/action.yml
1. The input includes DOCKER_BUILDKIT with a default of 1 (which is good)
1. The run command step doesn't make use of this input which means buildkit is off

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Merge a PR to main
2. Wait for the Deploy TRE workflow to run and see it fail.

title: DevContainer Reports "Workspace does not exist" for Non-Default Git Enlistments
body:
If you clone this repo to a folder other than the default (i.e. other then `AzureTRE` with that exact casing) you will see the following when opening the devcontainer in VS Code...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1524451/152757848-ad7031e9-8085-4244-b1b4-aa95cfc61c41.png)

I believe this is because we explicitly specify the workspace folder in `.devcontainer.json` as follows...

``` json
	"workspaceFolder": "/workspaces/AzureTRE"
```

We should determine if we really need this setting in the `.devcontainer.json` file as without it VSCode should simply open "the current folder" and do the right thing.

The above is an issue for anyone creating 2 enlistments, or who wants to control the name of the folder they clone code into

title: Guacamole: Connection to user resource fails if allocated IP address of old resource which has failed to delete

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
As mentioned in issue #1201 and #1163 User Resources currently fail to delete due to Key Vault purge protect.
This happens after the Virtual Machine is deleted and the IP used is freed.
If a new resource is then created and the old IP allocated, the connection uri created will match that of the previous resource.
On attempting to connect to the virtual machine a connection error is presented.

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Create a user resource in a Guacamole service
2. Delete the user resource
3. Wait for the delete to fail so the IP is free
4. Create a new user resource
5. Wait for it to be ready to use
6. Go to connection uri provided
7. Connection error

NOTE:  I have only tested this on a Ubuntu deployment.  Unsure if the same would happen for a Windows VM although I would expect it to.

https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/templates/core/terraform/keyvault/keyvault.tf
to
https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/templates/workspaces/base/terraform/keyvault.tf

1. Follow setup instructions https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/tre-admins/setup-instructions/getting-started/

3. Create Workspace, observe that in the core KeyVault Purge protection is disabled and in the Workspace KeyVault purge protection is enabled

title: Running `make tre-stop` causes the next `make tre-deploy` to fail

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
**Describe the bug**

Running `make tre-stop` will cause the next `make tre-deploy` ran in the same environment to fail.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Run `make tre-deploy tre-start tre-stop` 
2. Run `make tre-deploy` again

**Investigation**

This seems to be due to the fact that commands `make tre-start` and `make tre-stop` are [manipulating](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/devops/scripts/control_tre.sh#L8) the resource `fw-ip-configuration` which is [managed by terraform](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/templates/core/terraform/firewall/firewall.tf#L17). 

Because of this, Terraform wants to recreate it:

![MicrosoftTeams-image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52954123/150855645-b9ffd677-90ff-4d0f-a50c-3ebfd7b28db7.png)

However there is also a [lock](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/templates/core/terraform/firewall/firewall.tf#L25) on its parent resource. Because of this, Terraform fails to recreate it: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52954123/150855989-e500fc6b-5c25-45b4-9903-da37f8578d44.png)

Given that the resource managed by Terraform is also modified elsewhere, I think we should add a `lifecycle` [attribute](https://www.terraform.io/language/meta-arguments/lifecycle#ignore_changes) there, to reflect the fact that the `fw-ip-configuration` resource is modified by processes outside Terraform:

```
lifecycle {
    ignore_changes = [
      ip_configuration,
    ]
  }
```

title: [BUG] Subscription owner resource is being replaced when not changed

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
**Describe the bug**

This bug was split out from bug https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/700.

Each time `make tre-deploy` is ran, resource `module.resource_processor_vmss_porter[0].azurerm_role_assignment.subscription_owner` is being updated:

```
module.resource_processor_vmss_porter[0].azurerm_role_assignment.subscription_owner must be replaced
-/+ resource "azurerm_role_assignment" "subscription_owner" ***
      ~ id                               = "/subscriptions/***/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/deb370d9-e9c0-6ede-a44b-1f1ee3d2146d" -> (known after apply)
      ~ name                             = "deb370d9-e9c0-6ede-a44b-1f1ee3d2146d" -> (known after apply)
      ~ principal_type                   = "ServicePrincipal" -> (known after apply)
      ~ role_definition_id               = "/subscriptions/***/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/8e3af657-a8ff-443c-a75c-2fe8c4bcb635" -> (known after apply)
      ~ scope                            = "/subscriptions/***" -> (known after apply) # forces replacement
      + skip_service_principal_aad_check = (known after apply)
        # (2 unchanged attributes hidden)
    ***
```

This is happening even despite the fact that the value of the scope parameters doesn't change between updates.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Run `make tre-deploy`
2. Run `make tre-deploy` again and watch the resource being updated

title: Jumpbox Username and Password in KeyVault Not In Obvious Format and Docs Lack Clarity

milestone.title: Release 0.5
milestone.description: Improve Scaling and production readiness

body:
In order to complete setup you need to set up Shared Services:

https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/tre-admins/setup-instructions/configuring-shared-services/

During this phase you are asked to connect to the jumpbox using credentials stored in KeyVault.
The creds, in keyvault, are not clearly labelled "username" or "password", so it's not obvious which is which. Or, in fact that there's both a username and password present. You simply see something like this (not real)...

```
sd4f
Ds09435hc=&3w4hj@
```
... with no guidance that the first is a username, and the second is a password. They both look like part of a password that has wrapped across 2 lines.

Suggest: 

- add labels into this secret to make it clearer, or
- make the instructional text in the docs explain the format of this secret, or
- or, make the username look much more like a username (e.g. prefix it with `user_`)

Or all of the above

title: DOC: Many of the "copy to clipboard" examples actually cause output redirection
body:
**Describe the bug**
The online docs include example command lines that you can copy. For example, this page has several:

https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/tre-admins/setup-instructions/pre-deployment-steps/

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1524451/148427104-520294a2-9117-422f-9613-342b2911798a.png)

Notice that the text in this example is...

``` bash
/workspaces/tre> az login
```
The UI also includes a "copy to clipboard" UI element...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1524451/148427213-c2298127-9bc5-49a7-925c-5e0d274db8ec.png)

If you use this UI element you get `/workspaces/tre> az login` on your clipboard. This is not the command you want because this will actually try and redirect the output f `/workspaces/tre` to `az login`. In this case it'll fail, and be harmless, but in this case...

```
/workspaces/tre> ./scripts/aad-app-reg.sh -n TRE -r https://mytre.westeurope.cloudapp.azure.com/api/docs/oauth2-redirect -a
```
... what is does is delete the contents of the `aad-app-reg.sh` script!

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Go to https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/tre-admins/setup-instructions/pre-deployment-steps/
1. Click the "copy to clipboard" UI element for step 4
1. Paste this into your terminal
1. Observe that you have just deleted the contents of the bash script, and have seen the error `bash: /workspaces/tre: Is a directory`

title: Internal Server error on API GET request to /api/workspaces/{workspace_id}

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
**Receiving an Error when querying /api/workspace/{workpace_id}**
Following the [instructions](https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/tre-admins/setup-instructions/installing-base-workspace/) to install a base workspace after a fresh deployment of the TRE. After executing a POST to /api/workspaces, I get an '500: Internal Server Error' when attempting to GET /api/workspaces/{workspace_id}. However when executing a GET to /api/workspaces, I can see the deployment status of the workspace matching the {workspace_id}

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Create app registration for a new workspace
2. Add 'Workspace Owner' and 'Workspace Researcher' roles to my Azure logon on the corresponding Enterprise App
3. POST payload for a tre-workspace-base to /api/workspaces
4. Collect workspace_id from response
5. GET /api/workspaces/{workspace_id}
6. Server Response: 500: Internal Server Error
7. GET /api/workspaces produces a successful response and includes the workspace_id queried at (5)

title: [BUG] exfiltration path to storage accounts outside workspace
body:
**Describe the bug**
One of the stated goals of a workspace is "The workspace is a security boundary and there should be zero transfer of data out from the workspace unless explicitly configured." However, I found that in the base workspace's services subnet the [`Microsoft.Storage` service endpoint is enabled](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/templates/workspaces/base/terraform/network.tf#L16). According to [this page](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-networks-udr-overview) that means storage account calls are routed differently and bypass all other workspace controls. Thus it becomes easy for a user to copy data from within the workspace to a storage account outside the workspace.

title: Problem using Nexus to proxy docker hub

labels.name: design
labels.description: Figure out how we should do something

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
**Describe the bug**
I am trying to setup nexus in the AzureTRE environment to proxy docker hub. I believe I have nexus setup correctly and appropriate docker hosts added the the firewall rules. When I try to run `docker login` from a VM running in a workspace shared service subnet I see error similar to what is described [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49127414/docker-login-on-private-nexus-error-response-from-daemon-login-attempt-to-ht). According to [Sonatype docs](https://help.sonatype.com/repomanager3/formats/docker-registry/ssl-and-repository-connector-configuration) docker needs to be exposed on a different port than the standard ssl port nexus is already running on. However nexus is running in an Azure App Service and I don't see a way to expose custom ports.
**Steps to reproduce**

1. setup Nexus to [proxy docker hub](https://help.sonatype.com/repomanager3/formats/docker-registry/proxy-repository-for-docker)
1. add `*.docker.io` and `*.docker.com` to firewall rules to allow nexus to access them
1. create workspace and start vm in shared services subnet
1. connect to vm using bastion and run `docker login nexus-[tre_id].azurewebsites.net:[port]`
1. see timeout error


Acceptance criteria

- [x] #1479 
- [x] #1480 
- [x] #1481 
- [ ] Configure Docker Hub proxy in Nexus using a standalone port

title: Building InnerEye Workspace Fails with NoPublicIP Error on ML Compute Cluster
body:
**Deployment of InnerEye Workspace Fails from API because of Public IP Address Setting on Compute Cluster**

Deploying InnerEye Workspace via API fails during the build of machine learning compute workspaces

**Error Message**
code: PropertyNotAllowed
message: Cluster without public IP is not supported in the compute region. Please refer to this documentation for the regions support No Public IP cluster https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-pool-no-public-ip-address

**Steps to reproduce**

1.     Deploy TRE
2.     Publish tre-workspace-innereye using porter build and publish_register_bundle.sh script
3.     Deploy InnerEye Workspace via POST to /api/workspaces
4.     Check Deployment Status via GET /api/workspacess/{workspace_id}

**Temporary Fix**
Set parameter EnableNodePublicIp to 'true' in: templates > workspace_services > azureml > user_resources > aml_compute > terraform > deploypl_compute_instance.json

title: Building InnerEye Workspace from API fails if Location set to UKSouth

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
**InnerEye Workspace Deploy fails if Region set to UK South**

When building an InnerEye workspace via the API, the deployment fails if location for resources is set to 'uksouth'. 'uksouth' is not in the list of allowed locations for both:
1. templates > workspace_services > azureml > user_resources > aml_compute > terraform > deploypl_compute_instance.json and
2. templates > workspace_services > innereye > terraform > nopipcompute > deploypl_compute_cluster.json

**Error Message from Deploy**
Original Error: Code="InvalidTemplate"
Message=Deployment template validation failed: 
The provided value 'uksouth' for the template parameter 'location' at line '1' and column '581' is not valid. The parameter value is not part of the allowed value(s): 'eastus,southcentralus,westus2,eastus2,westeurope'.
with azurerm_resource_group_template_deployment.deploy_compute_cluster

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Set location in devops > .env to 'uksouth'
2. Deploy TRE
3. Publish tre-workspace-innereye using porter build and publish_register_bundle.sh script
4. Deploy InnerEye Workspace via POST to /api/workspaces
5. Check Deployment Status via GET /api/workspacess/{workspace_id}

**Temporary Fix**
Add 'uksouth' to list of parameters > location > allowedValues in both:
1. templates > workspace_services > azureml > user_resources > aml_compute > terraform > deploypl_compute_instance.json and
2. templates > workspace_services > innereye > terraform > nopipcompute > deploypl_compute_cluster.json
This allows deployment to proceed

```

title: [BUG] `make letsencrypt` failure
body: Following setup instructions (manual path), `make letsencrypt` step fails. Specifically, it is the following command in the script that fails: ```cmd az storage blob service-properties show -o tsv --account-name stweb --auth-mode login --query 'staticWebsite.enabled' ``` See https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/develop/templates/core/terraform/scripts/letsencrypt.sh#L19 **Steps to reproduce** 1. Start at https://microsoft.github.io/AzureTRE/tre-admins/setup-instructions/getting-started/ 1. Follow all the steps 1. Once you reach the `make letsencrypt` step, you'll see error: ```plaintext ERROR: Client-Request-ID=*** Retry policy did not allow for a retry: Server-Timestamp=Mon, 04 Oct 2021 11:16:12 GMT, Server-Request-ID=***, HTTP status code=403, Exception=This request is not authorized to perform this operation using this permission. ErrorCode: AuthorizationPermissionMismatchAuthorizationPermissionMismatchThis request is not authorized to perform this operation using this permission.RequestId:***Time:2021-10-04T11:16:13.4620371Z. ERROR: You do not have the required permissions needed to perform this operation. Depending on your operation, you may need to be assigned one of the following roles: "Storage Blob Data Contributor" "Storage Blob Data Reader" "Storage Queue Data Contributor" "Storage Queue Data Reader" If you want to use the old authentication method and allow querying for the right account key, please use the "--auth-mode" parameter and "key" value. ``` **Fix** that makes the command succeed is to make oneself *Owner* of the storage account, but that is not what we want in general. **The desired solution would be to enable the static-website hosting in Terraform** so that this piece of code could be removed from the script altogether. Related bug: #815

title: [BUG] Unexpected Nexus configuration step when running `make all`

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
The documentation implies that at the end of the `make all` run the user will presented with the output variables and they should proceed in running `make letsencrypt`. However, after the output variables "Configuring Nexus" step is initiated.

Related bug: #968

title: [BUG] Gitea not accessible from the internal network

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
The GITEA__server__ROOT_URL config is now pointing to public URL of Gitea. This works from the outside, but not from the workspace, where user should be accessing Gitea over internal address. 

In order to get both to work, Gitea should listen to https://url/gitea instead of https://url/.
nginx.conf needs to be set to /gitea as per: https://docs.gitea.io/en-us/reverse-proxies/#nginx-with-a-sub-path

- [ ] Modify the Gitea image to serve Gitea from /gitea
- [ ] Remove the override backendpath from Application Gateway GItea Http setting (from "/" to "")
- [ ] Change the path in Gitea health probe in Application Gateway from "/" to "/gitea"

title: [BUG] E2E tests fail with 401
body: E2E tests fail with 401 - understand why

title: [BUG] Excessive logging from Firewall

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
AML is trying to send logs to Azure Monitor/App Insights from Workspaces, which is being denied by the Azure Firewall. This fills the log with a large amount of data which incurs a cost.

The proper solution is #742 Enable private link for Azure Monitor.

The solution for now is to enable Azure ML and Dev Test Labs Workspace template to allow egress traffic to Azure Monitor.

title: [BUG] Message processing failed! Message with id = e48bc06d-a726-41c3-9d07-ef064f38d988 processed as False and marked complete.
body:
**Describe the bug**
When deploying the bundle in #929 the deployment fails, it is not clear why (could be linked to table storage length), either way the last log seen on the runner is: 

```
Message processing failed!
Message with id = e48bc06d-a726-41c3-9d07-ef064f38d988 processed as False and marked complete.
```

**Steps to reproduce**

Register and deploy the bundle in #929

title: [BUG] App Service fails to pull API image from ACR with message  'unauthorized: authentication required'

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
**Describe the bug**
TRE API app fail to start after deployment. Unable to pull the API image from the configured ACR.

Error messages found in log analytics logs:

```plaintext
docker run -d -p 8081:8081 --name api-****_1_6e2cd2de_msiProxy -e PORT=8081 -e WEBSITE_ROLE_INSTANCE_ID=0 -e WEBSITE_HOSTNAME=api-****.azurewebsites.net -e WEBSITE_INSTANCE_ID=521****0c01 -e HTTP_LOGGING_ENABLED=1 appsvc/msitokenservice:2007200210  

Pulling image from Docker hub: ****.azurecr.io/microsoft/azuretre/api:dev	

DockerApiException: Docker API responded with status code=InternalServerError, response={"message":"Get https://****.azurecr.io/v2/microsoft/azuretre/api/manifests/dev: unauthorized: authentication required, visit https://aka.ms/acr/authorization for more information."}

Image pull failed: Verify docker image configuration and credentials (if using private repository)

EventName:SiteStartFailed - Reason:Unknown - Message:Image pull failed since Inspect image returned null: ****.azurecr.io/microsoft/azuretre/api:dev - ContainerIDs: - AdditionalInfo: { "lastState":"Starting", "timeTaken":11, "port":-1 }
```

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Deploy the TRE using `make deploy-tre`
1. Hit the api status endpoint: `curl https://<azure_tre_fqdn>/api/status`
1. Failure response received: 503 service unavailable
1. Review log analytics logs for API app service instance
1. run `make deploy-tre` again
1. API status endpoint now returns 200 OK since app service was able to pull the image on 2nd attempt.

title: [BUG] App registration script places reply URL in wrong category
body:
The `aad-app-reg.sh` script places the given reply URL under "Mobile and desktop application". The right place is under "Single-page application". To fix the problem, inject the reply URL in the following block in the script:

```bash
declare swaggerUIApp=$(jq -c . << JSON
{
    "displayName": "${appName} Swagger UI",
    "signInAudience": "AzureADMyOrg",
    "requiredResourceAccess": ${swaggerRequiredResourceAccess},
    "spa": {
        "redirectUris": [
            "http://localhost:8000/docs/oauth2-redirect"
        ]
    }
}
JSON
)
```

...and remove:

```bash
if [[ -n ${replyUrl} ]]; then
    echo "Adding reply/redirect URL \"${replyUrl}\" to ${appName} Swagger UI app"
    az ad app update --id ${swaggerAppId} --reply-urls ${replyUrl} http://localhost:8000/docs/oauth2-redirect
fi
```

title: [BUG] Azure Firewall "randomly" destroyed by Terraform

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
**Describe the bug**
A couple of the team have seen Azure Firewall get destroyed by terraform. We are unclear as to why this happens.

It could be linked to https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-azurerm/issues/11043

I believe I saw it when no dependent resources have changed. However we are using `data` items to retrieve network details so maybe the data changed?

**Things to consider:**
As a first step lets prevent destroy of the firewall (unless in DEBUG mode)? Also lets create some Azure resource locks where appropriate.

@deniscep feel free to add to this.

title: If deploy two app service plans into a workspace they cannot integrate with the same subnet

labels.name: design
labels.description: Figure out how we should do something

milestone.title: Release 0.4
milestone.description:
- API updates - focus on workspace auth
- Finish basic functionality of Guacamole desktop service

body:
**Describe the bug**
A limitation of Azure Web Apps is each app service plan must have a dedicated vnet for vnet integration. This means if deploy two workspace services with their own app service plans vnet integration fails on the second.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Deploy Guacamole into a workspace
2. Deploy InnerEye Inference into the workspace

Possible resolution - deploy app service plan into the workspace rather than with the workspace-service

title: [BUG] Guacamole creates duplicate NSG rules on each deployment

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
**Describe the bug**
The guacamole service deploys NSG rules with static names and static priorities.

Either add the service ID to the name and calculate a the NSG priority, however feelthe rules would be better in the workspace base template as will be useful for other services as they are not actually guacamole specific:

```
resource "azurerm_network_security_rule" "allow-outbound-within-guacamole-and-api-subnets" {
  access                      = "Allow"
  destination_port_range      = "443"
  destination_address_prefix  = data.azurerm_subnet.web_apps_core.address_prefix
  source_address_prefix       = data.azurerm_subnet.web_apps.address_prefix
  direction                   = "Outbound"
  name                        = "outbound-workspace-webapps-to-tre-core-webapps" # guacamole access to api
  network_security_group_name = data.azurerm_network_security_group.ws.name
  priority                    = 200
  protocol                    = "TCP"
  resource_group_name         = data.azurerm_resource_group.ws.name
  source_port_range           = "*"
}

resource "azurerm_network_security_rule" "allow-inbound-within-webapps-and-services-subnets" {
  access                      = "Allow"
  destination_port_range      = "3389"
  destination_address_prefix  = data.azurerm_subnet.services.address_prefix
  source_address_prefix       = data.azurerm_subnet.web_apps.address_prefix
  direction                   = "Inbound"
  name                        = "inbound-rdp-from-webapps-to-services-subnets" # guacamole (webapp) and vm (service) are on different subnets
  network_security_group_name = data.azurerm_network_security_group.ws.name
  priority                    = 200
  protocol                    = "TCP"
  resource_group_name         = data.azurerm_resource_group.ws.name
  source_port_range           = "*"
}

```

body:
1. Give a user both the Researcher and Owner role

Owner should supersede Researcher and not the other way around - alternatively both roles should be returned

title: [BUG] Guacamole fails to pull the image from acr

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
The Guacamole webapp is the only one that does not have private end point, hence we get unexpected behavior when it comes to pulling the image from the acr.
For some reason, when the guacamole goes up, it tries to fetch the image from *Dockerhub* rather than the ACR iteself: 
```
Pulling image from Docker hub: anatacrops.azurecr.io/microsoft/azuretre/guac-server:dev
2021-09-15T09:14:00.464Z ERROR - DockerApiException: Docker API responded with status code=InternalServerError, response={"message":"Get https://anatacrops.azurecr.io/v2/microsoft/azuretre/guac-server/manifests/dev: unauthorized: authentication required, visit https://aka.ms/acr/authorization for more information."}
```

The only way I could work around it was to specifically put these vars in the config, which is not a best practice.
```
 DOCKER_REGISTRY_SERVER_URL      = "${data.azurerm_container_registry.mgmt_acr.login_server}"
 DOCKER_REGISTRY_SERVER_USERNAME = "${data.azurerm_container_registry.mgmt_acr.admin_username}"
 DOCKER_REGISTRY_SERVER_PASSWORD = "${data.azurerm_container_registry.mgmt_acr.admin_password}"

```


There is some info I found online about others who faced the same: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/60163440/docker-fails-to-pull-the-image-from-within-azure-app-service

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
When deploying or updating the TRE instance via Terraform, this issue sometimes appears:

```
╷
│ Error: locating Application Rule Collection "arc-shared_services_subnet" (Firewall "fw-mrdemo10" / Resource Group "rg-mrdemo10")
│
│   with module.firewall.azurerm_firewall_application_rule_collection.shared_services_subnet,
│   on firewall/firewall.tf line 84, in resource "azurerm_firewall_application_rule_collection" "shared_services_subnet":
│   84: resource "azurerm_firewall_application_rule_collection" "shared_services_subnet" {
│
╵
```

It seems to be a concurrency issue. TF tries to do multiple operations on the Firewall at the same time. Perhaps setting dependencies between the rules might solve the problem.

title: [BUG] tre-destroy can't purge Key Vault secrets
body:
Assuming that the design of tre-destroy should allow for this, the app registration created for AzureTRE should be granted additional permissions to include the necessary ones to purge secrets from the Key Vault.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Deploy TRE with the app registration created by aad-app-reg.sh
1. Destroy TRE
1. Observe this error (multiple times):
Error: purging of Secret "mysql-aztrehack23-password" (Key Vault "https://kv-aztrehack23.vault.azure.net/") : keyvault.BaseClient#PurgeDeletedSecret: Failure responding to request: StatusCode=403 -- Original Error: autorest/azure: Service returned an error. Status=403 Code="Forbidden" Message="The user, group or application 'appid=<snip>' does not have secrets purge permission on key vault 'kv-aztrehack23;location=eastus2'. For help resolving this issue, please see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2125287" InnerError={"code":"ForbiddenByPolicy"}

The new NSG rules on the app gw subnet block inbound port 80 which is needed for lets encrypt validation.

Either the lets encrypt script should add and remove or leave them off. Not sure if/how cert renewal works.

title: Changes the devcontainer base image to buster
body:
# PR for issue (bug) #770 

Changes the devcontainer base image from `bullseye` to `buster` to combat the Azure CLI problem with package version mismatch as described in bug report #770.

title: [BUG] devcontainer Dockerfile results in outdated azurecli (2.18)
body:
The Dockerfile installs the Azure CLI for Debian using a shell script found at https://azurecliprod.blob.core.windows.net/$root/deb_install.sh. That shell script sets the package source for azurecli to "bullseye," which appears to only contain azurecli up to version 2.18.

This, in turn, results in an issue when trying to login to the Azure Container Registry during the running of `make all`.

For Debian, it appears (to this non-Linux user) that `buster` is a better repo.

Workaround: we were able to update the package list to `buster` and run `sudo apt-get upgrade` to get az cli version 2.27.2. We could then login to the ACR and successfully continue with the makefile.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Build devcontainer.
1. Try to run `az acr login -n [somename]`
1. Observe error message
1. Run `az --version`

title: [BUG] Devcontainer fails to start

milestone.title: Release 0.1
milestone.description:
Once this work is complete we will look to merge to main and create a 0.1 release

* InnerEye AML workspace template

body:
Devcontainer fails to start due the following issues:

- [ ] *In Windows*, the volumes specified in `docker-compose.yml` fail since they are Unix-like environment specific

- [ ] The base image is based on `bullseye` whose packages repository does not appear to have contain Azure CLI release version

  ```plaintext

  #7 8.594 Reading package lists...
  #7 9.439 E: The repository 'https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/azure-cli bulls
  eye Release' does not have a Release file.
  ```

title: [BUG] POST for user-resource does not validate that service is a valid service type for the user resource

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
**Describe the bug**

When adding a user resource - we don't validate that the workspace service we are adding it to has a valid type. E.g. you can add a guacamole-vm to an innereye-service. The post does not check that the parent workspace service is of the guacamole type (as specified in the template)

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Add a workspace service template "guacamole"
2. Add a workspace service template "innereye"
3. Add a user resource template "guacamole-vm" that applies to "guacamole" workspace services
4. Create a workspace and add a innereye workspace service
5. Add a guacamole-vm to the innereye workspace service

This should fail with BAD REQUEST

title: [BUG] Make the ARM_TENANT_ID and ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable optional

milestone.title: Backlog

body:
When deploying TRE, the `ARM_TENANT_ID` and `ARM_SUBSCRIPTION_ID` should be defaulted to the current `az cli` session selected subscription.

title: [BUG] Registering two user-resource templates with the same name but for different workspace-service templates is handled incorrectly

milestone.title: Release 0.2
milestone.description:
* Source code mirror shared service
* App package shared service
* Virtual desktop workspace service
* Composition service enhancements to support user scoped resources (VMs)

body:
**Describe the bug**
1. If you try to create a new user-resource template (ex. vm) for workspace-service template (guacamole) and then later create another new user-resource template (also vm) but for workspace-service template (aml) - this fails if they have the same version
2. Same scenario as above but different versions -> the second user-resource template (vm for aml) will be set to current - but there will no longer be a current for user-resource template combo (vm for guacamole)

** Expected behavior**

A template author should be able to author two user-resource templates with the same name (ex. **vm**) for two different workspace-services (ex. **guacamole** and **aml**) and the user-resource-template-name + parent-service-template-name should be the unique key.

**Steps to reproduce**

In API
1. POST /api/workspace-service-templates/ with a template named "workspace-service-1"
2. POST /api/workspace-service-templates/ with a template named "workspace-service-2"
3. POST /api/workspace-service-templates/workspace-service-1/user-resource-templates/ with a template named "my-user-resource"
4. POST /api/workspace-service-templates/workspace-service-2/user-resource-templates/ with a template named "my-user-resource" (same version as previous)

This will fail saying the a template with the same version already exists (even though this is for another workspace-service)

5. POST /api/workspace-service-templates/workspace-service-2/user-resource-templates/ with a template named "my-user-resource" (change version)

Look in the database - the first template (for workspace-service-1) will no longer have current set.

title: [BUG] Wrong partition key is set for Resources CosmosDB container
body:
**Describe the bug**
The  Resources CosmosDB container is currently partitioned by a field called "appId". This field  is not set on the items in the container. Causing for that when calling queries on the container which require a partition key to fail.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Go to CosmosDB resource -> Data Explorer -> Azure TRE -> Resources -> Settings -> PartitionKey
1. Or see in the AzureTRE/management_api_app/db/repositories/base.py
1. To reproduce : In the AzureTRE/management_api_app/db/repositories/base.py add a method and call `self.container.delete_item(item=<item dict or id>,partition_key=<partition>)`

title: [BUG] Fix Unit Tests with improper dependency mocks
body:
Some tests have dependency mocks that are set to faulty values and/or not reset after the test are finished. This causes the tests to either call unnecessary code or work when they shouldn't due to remnants of earlier dependency mocks.

Additionally the improper mocks are seen as examples and copied in new tests

title: [BUG] - bootstrap.sh scripts depends on the absence of azure cli defaults (rg name)

milestone.title: Release 0.1
milestone.description:
Once this work is complete we will look to merge to main and create a 0.1 release

* InnerEye AML workspace template

body:
Remember to label the issue with the appropriate area, and also assign it to yourself if you plan to work on the issue in the near future.

**Describe the bug**
Using the devcontainer option, ran 'make all' and got the following error:
_(ResourceGroupNotFound) Resource group 'xyz-redacted-xyz' could not be found._
After investigating I noticed that the bootstrap.sh command is not receiving the resource group argument, which  means that if you have any default value already set it will use a wrong rg.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. set a default value for the rg using 'az config set' (set to a non-existing rg name)
2. use devcontainer env
3. run 'make all' 
4. it should fail as it is looking for the wrong rg

title: Resource processor function app not deployed as part of Quickstart

milestone.title: Release 0.1
milestone.description:
Once this work is complete we will look to merge to main and create a 0.1 release

* InnerEye AML workspace template

body:
When following the steps in the quickstart, you'll end up with a AzTRE instance without the resource processor function app deployed - preventing bundles from being deployed.

There is a `deploy-processor-function` target in the [Makefile](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/develop/Makefile#L67), but it is not called from `tre-deploy` nor mentioned in quickstart.

title: [BUG] Quickstart is missing auth configuration details
body:
**Describe the bug**
The solution required environment settings to be configured for auth:

```
# Auth configuration
AAD_TENANT_ID=__CHANGE_ME__
API_CLIENT_ID=__CHANGE_ME__
API_CLIENT_SECRET=__CHANGE_ME__
SWAGGER_UI_CLIENT_ID=__CHANGE_ME__
```

These are omitted from the quickstart. What steps do I need to follow?

In addition these variables are defined when provisioning the management infrastructure `devops/.env.sample` , when they should be defined with the core TRE infrastructure  `templates/core/.env.sample` as they may be different for each TRE environment.

title: [BUG] Multiple deployments are running in parallel causing state lock issues
body:
**Describe the bug**
When parallel TRE Deploy workflows run one run will fail due to Terraform state file locks. We should limit to one run at a time

**Steps to reproduce**

Merge two PRs immediately after each other.

title: Application insights configuration for API missing extension configuration

milestone.title: June 2021.2
milestone.description:
* Role based access control
* Enable deployment of multiple Workspaces
* InnerEye demo workspace template
* Polish documentation
* Merge to main and tag a 0.1 release.

body:
When viewing the Application Insights blade in the portal for the API web app, indication is given that the integration is not fully enabled.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/166592/123794341-03ed6f00-d8e3-11eb-9e09-32a2e5dec51b.png)

The instrumentation key is set why some data is sent to the logs but the full integration is not enabled. Manually enabling the integration from the portal adds additional configuration keys and values to the web app config.

Add missing config keys and values to enable the full integration.
`APPLICATIONINSIGHTS_CONNECTION_STRING`
`ApplicationInsightsAgent_EXTENSION_VERSION ~3`
`XDT_MicrosoftApplicationInsights_BaseExtensions`
et al.

[Reference](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/app/resource-manager-web-app)

title: Application Insights configuration for processor function broken

milestone.title: June 2021.2
milestone.description:
* Role based access control
* Enable deployment of multiple Workspaces
* InnerEye demo workspace template
* Polish documentation
* Merge to main and tag a 0.1 release.

body:
The `createNewWorkspace` function monitoring blade indicates that Application Insights integration is not enabled.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/166592/123793166-b7edfa80-d8e1-11eb-8906-b4175f4348e0.png)

At a first glance, the config seems to be there in [processor_function/function.tf](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/develop/templates/core/terraform/processor_function/function.tf#L24)
```plaintext
    APP_INSIGHTS_INSTRUMENTATION_KEY      = var.app_insights_instrumentation_key
```
however, the setting key name is incorrect.

Manually enabling the integration in the portal adds additional config keys:

`APPLICATIONINSIGHTS_CONNECTION_STRING`
`APPINSIGHTS_INSTRUMENTATIONKEY`

Need to add above keys with values to function app config.

[Reference](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/app/resource-manager-function-app)

title: [BUG]Errors in App Gateway config
body:
The application gateway needs to route `/docs/oauth2-redirect` to the API app as this is the OpenID connect redirect used by the Swagger UI.

Also, the storage account used for static web content has the network rule default action `Deny`. This storage account is used for static web content that is served publicly, so needs to be open. It is currently only used for Let's Encrypt domain verification, but will be used for a Web UI in the future.

**Describe the bug**

We should probably check does the image exists in ACR before submitting a run to processor, letting the user know that the template is registered but it doesn't have a corelated image.

title: [BUG] Workspace template registration doesn't enforce a mandatory "current"

body:
**Describe the bug**
If a workspace template is registered as an only version of that template, and the "current" is not set to "True", searching for that specific template will return not-found.

We should probably enforce that there must always be exactly one current template, or then return a message that template is found, but it has no current versions available.

2. GET workspace_templates -> the new template is listed

Related to and causes #278

title: [BUG] Key Vault script in tre-deploy target fails due to missing environment variable

milestone.title: June 2021.1
milestone.description:
- Composition service reports status on resource deployments.
- Workspace bundle registration.
- Allow for demo deployments of workspaces supporting InnerEye training and inference.

body:
`/devops/scripts/set_contributor_sp_secrets.sh` is run as part of the `tre-deploy` target in Makefile. If run **manually**, the script will fail, because `TRE_ID` environment variable is not defined. The Makefile target loads environment variables from .env files, but injects `TF_VAR_` prefix so although TRE ID is in the environment variables, it has a name the script is not expecting.

**A** solution is to also use `load_env.sh` to process the `/templates/core/.env` file in `tre-deploy` target.

title: [BUG] Running make build-api-image fails on docker not installed

milestone.title: June 2021.2
milestone.description:
* Role based access control
* Enable deployment of multiple Workspaces
* InnerEye demo workspace template
* Polish documentation
* Merge to main and tag a 0.1 release.

body:
**Describe the bug**
When going over quickstart on a clean environment (on Mac). 
make bootstrap completes successfully but then `make build-api-image` fails on docker not installed.

The way to workaround it is to run the following commands manually, including docker build using sudo:
build-api-image:
	echo -e "\n\e[34m»»» 🧩 \e[96mBuilding API Image\e[0m..." \
	&& . ./devops/scripts/check_dependencies.sh \
	&& . ./devops/scripts/load_env.sh ./devops/.env \
	&& docker build -t "$${ACR_NAME}.azurecr.io/microsoft/azuretre/management-api:$${IMAGE_TAG}" ./management_api_app/

 

**Steps to reproduce**

1. run `make bootstrap` successfully
2. run `make mgmt-deploy`
2. run `make build-api-image`
3. Get the following error:
»»» ✅ Checking pre-reqs...

Checking for Azure CLI...

**Checking for Docker...
»»» **⚠️ Docker is not installed! 😥 Please go to https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ to set it up****

4. Run the commands manually
     ./devops/scripts/check_dependencies.sh \
     ./devops/scripts/load_env.sh ./devops/.env \
     *sudo* docker build -t "$${ACR_NAME}.azurecr.io/microsoft/azuretre/management-api:$${IMAGE_TAG}"

title: [BUG] Registered template details are not returned by API

When register a template, such as `azureml_devtestlabs` using `https://xxx.cloudapp.azure.com/api/workspace-templates` and then retrieve with `https:/xxx.cloudapp.azure.com/api/workspace-templates/tre-workspace-azureml_devtestlabs` get:

```
{
  "errors": [
    "Workspace template does not exist"
  ]
}
```

**Steps to reproduce**

1. `cd /workspaces/azureml_devtestlabs`
1. `../../devops/scripts/publish_register_bundle.sh -u https://xxx.cloudapp.azure.com -r xxx -t workspace -i`
1. `curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://xxx.cloudapp.azure.com/api/workspace-templates/tre-workspace-azureml_devtestlabs' \
  -H 'accept: application/json'`

@TessFerrandez can you have a look at this. Thanks.

| │ Error: authorization.RoleAssignmentsClient#Create: Failure responding to request: StatusCode=403 -- Original Error: autorest/azure: Service returned an error.
